ok so it's a damn blizzard out, million mph winds and everything is covered in ice. ridiculous. ran to kasota (this little hick town by my school - our standard windy day loop) and i get to the 4 mile point - after going past the trailer park and the goat farm - and there's this low income housing apartment on the corner and these kids that live there always feel compelled to remind my teammates and me that we're faggots. well running by it today, one of the little dousches hangs his head out the window and yells 'fuck you you stupid fag! fuckin idiot! so i say to my teammates, 'we're stopping'. i click my watch and run under his 2nd story window, and ask him if he thinks yelling at people makes him cool. he's like 'what?' and i was like, why were you yelling at us? what did we do? do you think my teammates and i are homosexuals? he then leans his head out again and says 'sorry, im on the phone i cant hear you' to which i replied alright you little bitch, get down here and say your shit to my face. so the front door to the building opens and a dozen kids from mid-elementary school to probably 10th grade come spilling out. one of my teammates is back on the road, the other one is with me. their group has a clear spokesperson, so i get in his face and ask why they were yelling shit at us, he says' we weren't' fuck that. i told him i saw him and that they yell everytime we go by. he says they never have and asks if i think i'm tough cuz im yelling at little kids; much to the chuckles of his little inbred bitch friends. then it all came down. profantiy was flying, i lost my composure, my teammate wished them luck repopulating the world with their sisters, said if we ever heard them cock off again they wouldn't be in any physical condition to speak to us, then we parted ways with the kids who were nothing more than the overweight, white trash results of their mom's $20 trick and an expired condom. then a few miles later a car starts honking behind us, it's their leader and a few of them, they flip us off and drive by. then a train comes and the gates go down. we start sprinting after them, now knowing that they have to stop. the little fucks go around a truck and between it the train to get on a side road and drive away from us. we yelled to meet us back at our school, and when we were going up the hill to campus, there they were. we picked up ice chunks, thinking, maybe they'll drive by with their windows down to yell something and we can just hit them in the teeth with the ice. once they saw us they honked again and took a different road. never saw them again. but i'm sure we will.

moral of the story, as soon as i turn 21, i'm getting a concealed carry permits, and a gun small enough to fit in my running shorts pocket.

fished that (and it was miserable - forgot how heavy trainers feel after a few miles). finished behind hartman, caught and ran away from kennedy in the last half mile, anders fell back a second or two in the last half also.

from there we jumped right on the track and i ran 5:04.

the 5:04 didn't feel all that hard. the last 300 i was definitely going all out, but i didn't want to die so the first 3 laps were paced. fast, but controlled. hate 'could have's' and 'should have's' but IF id have known i wouldn't die, i could have went sub 5 for the last one. i was holding back in places.

not bad for griak - hilly as usualy, wet as usual, but it actually wasn't raining during the race. felt pretty good, though i eased up around 6k i think preparing for a final push. went back and forth with devon monson, finally beat biggers, monson out kicked me in the last 100.but i beat the zeiens and JD rojas and austin hinrichs... and victor sanchez! again, finally. this has the makings of a good season, possibily. 5 miles once i got back to GAC and felt like i was floating. good day overall. just really hope the team steps up when it matters. id really like 6 guys ahead of me.
shake out when i got back to campus. felt really really good.

golf-course-who-knows-where-i-am-with-the-intention-of-Cleveland-steamer-except-we-missed-a-turn-and-ended-up-at-lake-washington-and-asked-some-lady-for-directions-back-and-then-made-up-a-route-back-and-finished-golf-course-who-knows-where-i-am. the name pretty much says it all. for future reference, cleveland takes the same left at dog creek that who knows where i am turns, and just continues past 311. hartman and i ran this together, got rained on a little, but really not a bad run at all. felt good once we got past extended, and luckily we found a woman who gave us directions at about mile 9 or ten, otherwise the out and back would have been our only option. this run wouldn't quite be the same if we knew where we were going though, so i consider it a success. i guess kurt and marbar got a little confused when 311 became 111, and they didn't know how to get out to 99. i love these kinds of runs. thank you, john leaf.

super nice day out. little weary about the distance with my leg the way it is, but i'm tired of fake training. ran the hill workout course with max hanson. didnt push anything, just ran it easy to get some hills in. felt really good. party tonight and some bethel guysming down, so i may have running partners tomorrow.

ramble on from the dorm plus ring road and a little out and back to be safe. ran the first 4 with kuhn, his legs were pretty beat up from racing yesterday - but he made it 9 or 10, so it's all good. ran the rest with greeno - was pretty awesome to have someone to run the whole distance with again, and neat to see insight from people outside of GAC. the route was nice, it was warm and a rare windless day. traction wasn't awful, less maybe a few places on the gravel. had some good conversation and the run went well, especially being that it's my first legit long run since cross. could definately tell by my breathing at the end that i'm still a ways from where i want to be. outdoor conference is a long ways off though - and i'm already pumped.

just an easy run, with my body not being 100%, going a little farther than expected yesterday, and the workout tomorrow, i figured just having a down day was a good idea. felt fine - we'll see how tomorrow goes.

can you tell i havent done any speedwork? everything was exactly even pace. lame right? i just dont have the gears yet, but for the first track workout, i wont complain. that, in addition to the fact that this was on our rectangle track with the basketball hoop into lane 2. i was the only one to not do some abbreviated version of the workout, and even in the repeats i ran by myself until bartley kicked up on me at the end of the intervals. he had a good day. i kept the team (whoever ran behind me anyway) on even pace, and i'm glad about that. now i just gotta hold this for a 10k....

maybe a little more, maybe i'm just tired. today's run felt relatively like poop. i gotta get back to morning runs to shake things loose. overdressed today, but that was only part of the problem. and the the F'ing trainers.... i hate them and their damn new toys that are all glitz and glamor but lack functionality. i don't care that your new ice bath fits 8 fucking people and cost $20,000, and is salt water and circulates and has jets.... the thing could give me a hand job while i'm in it, but if it's only 61 degrees, i may as well spend my time shitting in my hand. can you tell i'm mad?

roads were all ice, and we have a threshold workout today - which obviously couldnt happen with no traction, so coach huber cancelled the workout and we had a mandatory 8:30 pool workout. it was hard, but i dont think it replaces the AT workout. we'll see if i can still get it in.

tried racing at the mankato open. 5k, went through the mile in 5:01/5:02, legs and cardio felt great, but from lap 2 on, my dull randomly recurring side stitch got sharper, then developed into two, had me running bent over, and by 2900 meters i couldn't breathe from the pain so i stepped off. coach H said he was gonna pull me the next lap anyway cuz i was a mess. i dont understand this phenomena. it happens randomly, usually at the beginning of a season, and once, maybe twice a year. hopefully it's over. im sure once i felt it i panicked a little, but who wouldn't. im sure that didnt help. world keeps on a' turnin though. i'll bounce back.

didnt know the workout till after the warmup, then brenden took our watches, and had the girls in order from slowest to fastest (generally) start one at a time every 10 seconds. then the same with boys with maybe a minute between the girls and us. my goal was to catch everyone by bus farm road (just over 2 miles into it) i was 3:10 or 3:20 behind the leader. like clockwork i took the lead the the corner of busfarm road. seemed to back off pace a little on top of the hill, it was windy and i had no more people to catch. on fort road i heard kuhn closing behind me and i took off. the last 800 or so i was going all out. held him off physically, but he beat me by 1 second after figuing in the stagger. hartman also beat me by a bit. gosh running fast in trainers is really hard. those things are heavy. also, we didnt know how long this would be. brenden said he'd be pulled over on the side of the road somewhere.

5:26 pace overall for the fast portion.

most awesome run i've done in a long time. went exploring with a general idea where we were going. i knew there was a cut off of 7 up silo that was close to 10. found it, and after some searching we found the trail that led to the road back from silo. it was nice running on soft earth for a bit, and it honest to god looked like we were in arizona. then arkansas. there is an exact replica of the grand canyon, and we got to run through it. cant believe we never knew this existed. definately a new staple run. it shall be called tumbleweed. we then ran through the woods to explore the john leaf haunted house/deer camp. which, subsequently happened to be awesome also. good runs today.

6:27, 5:54, barefoot. normally i dont talk about strides/lifiting/core in here, but the strides i did tonight felt exceptional. going to make this a down week, which is tough, cuz my mind and my body want to just hammer out miles. im sure this will be good in the long run though.
bleh.

turned into kind of a progression run. 

went out in ~6:50, through 2 in 13:30, felt really good, but knew i had a ways to go, so i kept the pace in check till i was inside of 5 miles to go, still feeling good, so i (cautiously) opened it up a little. never to where i was working hard, just sorta letting the legs breathe a bit. started visualizing Conference, Regions... imagined the 4 mile mark at wartburg and just dropping into the highest gear i had, picturing the most improbably of circumstances, being on the shoulder of a mid distance champ - gilbertson, campbell, whomever, and knowing that i had to outkick them for a spot at nats. do i expect this? no. do i want to be prepared? yes, and it helped me get through this run. This will be a down week after 3 weeks of building, and then the coming 3 weeks will hopefully put me at or near where i want to be hanging out for the summer. I can't say i'm training harder than anyone in the conference this summer, but i will say i will be training just as hard as anyone else. lifting, drills, strides, core, miles miles miles. This is the last chance to make it happen.

definitely didnt think i was going this fast. super hot out, and tried to take it really easy. about 8 miles in i caught up to an older (60?) guy out running, probably about 8 minute pace so i thought what the heck, slowed down and as i caught him i said, 'so how far we going today?' he told me what he was doing and i trotted the next 3 quarters of a mile or so with him. turns out he used to be pretty big into marathons and whatnot, ran back in his college days, as always, the older generation always has some wisdom to impart. eventually we split and i got back to my car and litterally collapsed in the grass. as i type this 3 hours later i still don't feel right. pretty dehydrated, not used to the heat, lost like 4 pounds on this run. pretty crappy.
fast i guess
felt really in control today. felt good. i could pick it up, slow it down, it all felt the same, so i just kept it up.

was going to go for another tonight, but got to play mediator of a family domestic dispute so that never happened. anyway, this last 3 up one down session was just getting my legs back under me. the 'real' training starts this upcoming week.

pretty cool new approach to running today. i call it 'just running' never looked at my watch, had no set distance in mind, didn't do any pre-determined route, just ran around town until i was no longer enjoying it, then i went back the high school, did 2 miles barefoot and then called it quits. I'll be doing this more often.
barefoot. did this as a part of my normal run, just logging it seperately to not add the miles to my shoes

this run was simply amazing. 3 mile add on from the HS, the 2 miles barefoot felt magical. like i could have pr'ed in any event i wanted. my legs would turn over as fast as i wanted them to, and there was no noticeable tiredness from it. nearly dark, damp grass, no wind, no people. this run, was in a word, Perfect.

oh my hotness.

for starters, my legs felt like they had really viscous blood flowing through them. not stiff, but just... slow. then it's about 400 degrees out there, no joke, saw a kid cooking a frozen pizza on the blacktop. every square inch of my shorts were soaked by mile 5, which led to a sloppy, sloshy rest of the run. just gross. 2.5 miles barefoot around the athletic fields afterwards.
barefoot
1.5 miles barefoot. again, my blood felt viscous. that's the best way i can describe it. or like i was running through very un-dense water.
hot hot. pretty bland run.
body felt kinda funky. i never really got into a rhythm, and that made this run feel like it took forever. 2.25 miles barefoot afterward in conjunction with this run, logged separately.

barefoot. pretty stiff getting started on this one, 3 and half hours after finishing my morning run. i did this just to shake out a little, and to get warmed up for lifting and all that stuff that i never want to do.
kept it easy

8k race in minnetonka. 2 mile w/u, 5 mile race, little under 4 for the c/d

just meant to be a rust buster. i wanted to do as little as possible to win, just so i could get the gift card and buy new shorts.

one guy was being pretty serious about it so i sat on him till mile 3. then matt wiersum and i broke him and ran the rest of the way together, pretty conversational the whole time. we made a dramatic, lean at the tape type of finish and tied in 28:17 i think. but for as ungodly easy as 28:17 felt, i'm feeling good about the training i've been doing.

then it turned out TC running didnt open till 10, and i have to work so i didnt get my shorts today :(

1 mile of this was barefoot.

so the plan was to double either yesterday or friday, whichever day i felt better, and i felt great both nights, but both nights by the time i got off work it was lightning and there were tornado warnings and i just couldn't justify it. I was going to double, then go about 16 today to put me at about 103-104 for the week, but then that obviously didnt happen. I really didnt feel like running 20 this morning before work, so i figured i'd go just over 17 then come back with a 2 or 3 mile shakeout tonight. I know it's a weinerish way to get to 100, and doubling on long run day isn't the best idea, but i'll be sitting around for 8 hours before i get off work. i'll survive. i'll probably do it barefoot and just use it as a shakeout/strengthening type of thing. not ideal, but i'm not gonna finish a week at 98 point. stupid weather.

What a douchey way to hit the hundo.

barefoot

felt pretty good today, the run was physically, as well as mentally easy, which is always nice. 60's and breezy made this feel awesome. then i rush through strength stuff when i get home so i can get to work, only to get there and be told to go home cuz of the 68 degree weather. Im on call till 6. stupid.

kinda sluggish today. just took a while longer to get moving. my first half mile took 4 minutes... oh well, i have the next 3 days to go back to my hermit lifestyle of running, lolling around the rest of the day, running again, then sleeping. so i'll get recovered.
2 barefoot, first few steps my legs felt clumsy and my shoes felt like they were made of lead. went away quickly

planned on going 8 today, but at mile 2 i was feeling great and a devilish little idea popped into my head, but i tucked it neatly away in the back for later. as i was finishing my 8 mile loop i still felt great and figured id take advantage of the cool weather and feeling good and get my long run out of the way today so i dont have to spend the entire time up at the cabin running, especially if it's going to be hot. can't really get much better than 60's and breezy. felt really good throughout this one, 2.25 miles barefoot. today marks the most miles i've ever run in 3 days (52.7), most ever in a 7 day period (110), and the most heavily front loaded week to date. sick.

I MAY run like... a mile tonight, just to stay in the rhythm of 2 a days, and i feel like a shakeout may be in order after fairly cruising through this 17.

today is a good day. 17 easy miles, sweet tea and a chocolate shake from the dairy store afterward :)

slow getting going, loosened up by mile 3 or 4, then started to roll... slowed it down a bit at the end. still feeling good. got straight up stalked by a sex offender today for the duration of my run. he kept driving by, turning around, driving by again. for about 2 blocks he just drove 9 or 10 mph along side me and stared at me. long dark hair, big black beard, old tan buick or something... stereotypical sex criminal.

2.25 barefoot

this outs me at 112 in the last 7. boom.
legs felt like garbage. i felt clumsy and tired the whole way. luckily, i get to cool the mileage jets for a while now.
just went by time on this one, ran with brooke. went a little over just to make sure. up at the cabin.

2 mile warm up, 5k race in siren wisconsin. not a bad course, though the finish sucked. beat marty joyce for the first time in my life.

kinda just wanted to burn off a little carbon, air out the legs and see what happened. i gave it about 95% effort, but after the first thousand it was strung out and i was in 3rd a long ways out from 2nd and 4th. Sean Kutz from UW oshkosh took the win in 15:32, Jack Taylor was second, and with about a mile to go i closed the gap between us to about 10 meters, but i couldn't [was too big of a pussy to] finish the move, and he eventually ran away. it monsoon rained the entire time, making for an interesting run. they have me at 16:14, though the clocks were down for a little while, so who knows what the time actually was. not bad for no speed, a couple 100 mile weeks, and the effort i put into it.

solid last 300m

7.5 mile cooldown.
really hot and humid. ran with brooke at the cabin again.

frustrating run.

ran with Rough for the first 7, cuz he asked me to, and getting him to talk, much less make coherent conversation is about as likely as petersen running a 40 mile week while working at the international 'we wont let you train' sports center. that, and he isn't in shape and we had to stop at 5 miles for 5 or 6 minutes so he could catch his breath. then we finished 7 and i tacked on 2 more, still falling short of what i wanted to do this morning. double tonight.
3 barefoot. i felt like i was stopping every quarter mile to expel gasses from my system in one form or another. evidently, sloppy joes and mountain dew don't make a great pre-run meal.
upper thigh by the inguinal groove feels unhappy.
hot. upper thigh still being an issue, though not as terrible. just feeling kinda run down

6:51, 6:31, 5:52

this down week is already making me want to get back into the 1xx's

first 4 or 5 with brooke, tough day for her.

my upper thigh is getting pretty annoying though.

taking it easy to try to heal the leg a bit. today felt the best it has felt since becoming a problem. good signs.

i got skull fucked by a junebug today. there was a woman out doing some sort of tempo run in the middle of nowhere, and i couldnt be behind her for pride's sake. i had to actually work a little to catch her (granted she was a long way off) but i eventually did and flew past her. as soon as i get past her this junebug thwaps me in the eye and i had to stop for nearly 10 minutes before i could open it again and the water to go away. she of course passes me back, and must have thought i was a huge tool. hot again today, 2 miles barefoot.

run up in south minneapolis from minnehaha falls park with the GAC/bethel guys. really good time catching up with everyone, plenty of conversation to keep the run going smoothly. weather was just about perfect, and the barbecue afterwards went well. really nice getting out of hastings and off the pavement onto some soft trails - good to see bethel guys again too. just a good day.
pretty mechanical. it was like i was on a bike in a high gear on flat ground. the effort was there but it was steady, never really got more taxing. mile 2 felt like mile 12.

wasn't planning on this big of a double, but the opportunity arose to meet at chris river's place off hiawatha and run with him, leaf and jason havey, and while that in itself was appealing, finding out that afterwards involved a short order resturant and $1 bottle beers (summit, fat tire, a couple types of goose island, and all the regular suspects) how could i say no. legs felt absolutely terrific, could have tempo run tonight had it not been for the rock in my intestines. it hurt so badly but i couldn't crap it out to save my life. probably had to do with the 7 cheeseburgers, frozen pizza and butterfinger blizzard that composed my last 24 hours of eating.

now to look for tuesday deals.

went for a 10 mile walk.

really kept the brakes on today to make sure and recovery from yesterday.

2 barefoot.

strange, strange run. really didnt want to do this one, tried talking myself out of it, really really did.

sucked for the first 2 minutes, but then the weirdest thing happened. i fell into this... transcendent altered state. i literally felt like i was high. I dont remember seeing where i was going, i was only vaguely aware that my body belonged to me, and i felt NOTHING. i didnt feel my joints, my muscles, i didnt feel my feet touching the ground. at mile 3 i touched/rubbed my face and head, didnt feel it. it was as if my nerves were on hiatus. somewhat phased out of it in the last mile, but i dont know wtf was going on. maybe i was dehydrated, maybe something is going on with me, maybe i ate/drank something that was drugged. either way, pretty unique run.
ran with brooke.
never really felt good on this one.
2 miles barefoot. pretty garbage-y run. my diet has been crap this week and eating a pizza and peanut butter toast 1.5 hours out from this one didnt help.
felt better today

1 mile barefoot.

much needed shakeout after sitting in the cooking hot sun all day today.
pretty crappy run. not a lot of sleep, almost 80 and humid already at 8am. ice bath time...

pretty smooth, low 70's but a nice wind. felt the fitness carry me today. it was one of those runs where you could go 10 or you could go 20 and it would feel about the same. not really excited mentally about going over 14, but the body held up well. surprisingly, this may have been the best my legs have felt since monday's afternoon 10
stayed really relaxed today

minneapolis with chris. truely living the dream

calf was being irritating, gonna keep an eye on that

got up this morning, and my achillies/calf was still really tight and sore, i slept with an ice pack on, massaged it when i got up, thought i'd try it out. took a couple steps in my shoes and it just screamed. so i got pissed, threw my shoes off and ran back inside. well as it turns out running barefoot didnt hurt at all, and actually felt kinda good, so i went 7 miles barefoot around the athletic fields. the last week or 2 i've really been slacking at barefoot running, and i could feel myself going back to heel striking, so that may be part of the problem. i may be seeing a lot of the athletic fields this week, at least to start my runs and get loosened up.

obviously like to double tonight and get at least 15 in for the day, but coming in to today not knowing if id run or not, i' not gonna do anything stupid

2 mile warmup barefoot, the rest on the roads. got new shoes today thinking that may help my ailment, and it did, but i can feel myself not landing as forward on my foot as id like, or was a few weeks ago. i suppose the accumulated tiredness of muscles due to high mileage could be at fault there. anyway, i got in 15 today, which i thought was out of the question when i woke up. i thought today would be zero, so this was a pleasant surprise.
found a trigger point in my calf last night that loosened up my achillies. definately better today, just a dull ache. i'll keep icing though
this was over 5, but close enough. felt pretty darn good actually. wasn't planning on this but figured this way i was one step closer to pushing to 110, or coasting in to 100

went a little later to make the gap between storms, misted a little, then got super humid - you could see steam rising from the roads... eventually got cloudy again and cooled a little. calf was getting pretty sore/tight out there. stopped once to massage it, helped a little. i'll take care of it this afternoon. really dont know what im shooting for this week for mileage yet.
calf an issue today

as i went out the door tonight, i actually said to my mom, 'lets hope i make it to the end of the driveway'

after icing and massaging all day today, it wasnt bad. and with the exception of the calf, i feel amazing right now.

also, you heard it here first: if i can massage/ice/willpower my way through the next 36 hours and make this a solid week, i will sacrifice monday - regardless of how good or bad i feel, entirely to the recovery gods.

'The object, according to Denton, was to 'run through' the thing, just as he maintained one should attempt to 'run through' most of those other little hubcaps life rolls into your lane; everything from death in the family to cancer of the colon.'

This was my 'quit being a pussy run' for July.

I started off modest, 6:45 min/mile or so for the first 3, just testing out the calf which has had ice on it more than it hasn't for the last 24 hours. it felt like... like someone took a solid swing with a bat into the back of my lower leg, and then told me to go running. it may very well be bruised from all the rolling/grastoning. but bruising is better than adhesion, so bring it. anyway, i found myself out on the run today starting to pick up the pace, not pressing, but just floating - i'd catch it and slow back down to around 7 minute miles. between miles 5 and 6 i thought wtf, a lot of my friends/teammates are running the lumberjack 10 miler today, and if i didnt have to work id be racing it, so around mile 6 i decided i'll just let it go and roll with it. I kept it slower than tempo run pace (effort), just worked on running fast, relaxed. the only split i got was my last mile, 5:42, rolling through 10 miles in 1:02:06 (6:12.5 pace) then i tacked on 2 more slow ones just to cool down a bit. not a bad time considering i really only went for it for the 2nd half.

now to ice!
shakeout. probably a good thing.

ran up in the cites with JL. pretty awesome route he came up with over into st paul and down summit. felt surprisingly good - cant complain about that. good conversation too. note to self, never get drunkenly lost in the cities. this has been the hardest ive had to fight through a week to get to the mileage i wanted, not because of how my body feels, per say, just that damn calf. i felt great this week otherwise. taking tomorrow off, which is going to drive me insane, but im sure its worth it in the long run, or at least thats what people tell me. so goodbye top 20 for a week, i'll see you soon.

ran up in breezy point, first 10 with brooke, then 4 more on my own. the 4 i did on this tangled network of minimum maintenance roads, which was beyond incredible. almost stepped on deer a couple times. raining, cool the whole time. kinda pissed about only getting 14 today, but also not sure if this is going to be a down week, then 2 up, then down before camp, or if i just stay up, have 2 more in the 100-115 range then camp. meaning i'd have 5 100+ (or 6 day equvalent) weeks in a row. most likely i'll just run whatever i feel like this week and it'll be about 85 in 6 days. we'll see. i'll take advice if anyone has thoughts

something is wrong here. my pace was all over the place today, but absolutely was not averaging 7:13. there were times where i was going 7:13 probably, but never slower, and there were definitely stretches of sub 6:40. maybe i didnt hit stop when i stopped to scratch my bug bites or something. oh well. i think i'm going to take this week as recoveryish, then 2 in the 100-11x range, then down before camp, then 2 more back up during camp/before classes start.

dont know whats going on with me right now. maybe it was the day off... who knows. first 1.5 miles was like 7:10 pace, and i was with my mom who was biking, and felt like i was actually fairly cruising. granted i was running around out by my house so my splits may be off, or maybe im just slow. my last 1.5, that i know for sure is accurate, was 10:18, or 6:52 pace. still seemed faster. hm.

Dear body,

We've known each other for some time now, and we've been through a lot. You're good at most things, i mean - the girls you bring in have never been dogs, and for that i'm thankful. I know sometimes i dont feed you the best things, but you enjoy it for a little while right? i mean, those chinese buffets are good going down arent they? Lately though, you've been making running less than pleasurable for me. is there any way we can resolve this? I know i ask a lot of you, so i'll be patient, but if you could take care of things by the end of the week it would be great, because, well... Much like a 17 year old at a frat party or oprah winfrey on 'The Color Purple', whether you want to or not, you're gonna get it.

love love,
Me
felt marginally less terrible this morning. raining.

2 miles and 9 strides. normally i wouldn't log this, however i came up with something groundbreaking, and miles are miles.

WARNING: if you get offended easily, or at all, ever, just stop reading now.

knowing that giving a disclaimer does nothing but pique interest, and no one has stopped yet; read on.

somewhere out in my delirium i came up with a new word, and feel it should be shared with the world.

the word describes what female porn stars do when they go do work.
That word is: schlonk.

they don't have sex, the don't even fuck. they schlonk. It's like a combination of bonk and schlong, both fitting subjects. I feel it is prefectly tasteless and classless, sounds passive enough to be completely void of emotion, and with just the right degree of vulgarity. to me it sounds like how you would describe a really loose chick getting slapped in the cooter with a big rubber dong and it just slippin' right on in. 

'Wow martha, i cant believe how hard he schlonked me today!'

The masculine form of the word, now hold on to your seats, is flonk.

same concept.

'yeah Tim, I'd stay away from sally, there's no tread left. she bent over and i just flonked it right in.

Remember folks, you heard it here first. mainstream by labor day.

mistakes i made today:

the first loop (10.4 miles) i ran at 6:35 pace.

the deep massaging and strides last night seemed to help a bit. felt stronger today, still not perfect, but i wont complain.

I gotta settle the pace down. like Wejo said, its just about being out there.

down in St. peter with the guys. run was a death march. i mean, the first 12 were ok, not amazing, but ok. after that it got tough, and the last 3 i was dizzy, delirious... didnt think id make it back, no question the worst long run ive ever done. I was gonna call it after 15 but bartley has never gone 18 and wanted to do it, so wtf. Anyway, the plan was to go down after work, get there around 1030, make poor lifestyle choices, then run with kuhn, delaubs, kurt, marbar, and brooke. well let's just say some of the guys had nights that ended up better than mine did (insert coy, sexual tone) and i ended up running with just marbar and brooke.

I didnt sleep that long, was super dehydrated, it was hot, humid, and in retrospect, i didnt eat enough food yesterday. bonked hardcore today, but i'm not concerned, as there were so many factors at play. i have nothing to do now, so im gonna sleep all afternoon, but brooke has to work a 9 hour shift, on her feet the whole time. how terrible right? i started this run weighing 151, and after running it, eating a 32 ounce jamocha shake, an erbs and gerbs sub, a 32 ounce gatorade, 2 glasses of water, another glass of gatorade, and 16 ounces of diet coke, i weigh 148.8. i wonder how much i lost during that run. someday i'll do the math.

that which doesn't kill me...

came to terms with the necessity of running slow today, maybe even for a couple of days. i've had too good of a summer to fizzle out now, so i'll let the jets rest a while and get recovered. may or may not have time for a double later. either way i'm looking to get back in the 110 range this week, give or take 5 or so i guess.

cut this run about a mile short, because at 84 degrees and 80% humidity, it was my hottest run of the summer.

other than that, the body felt good.

felt really smooth tonight. still really humid and hot, but as the sun went down at least that wasnt beating on me. i think the lack of protein in my diet last week was part of why i felt so bad. i've been eating a ton more now, and i feel a lot better. breakdown training: 0
me: 1
wanted to go 12, just too humid. not as bad as yesterday though. could have gone a little slower i guess.

pace is laughable, but i bet my first 2 miles were 8:00. this is still a victory in my mind, cuz i ate half a jar of peanut butter not long before this and i spent the entire run heaving and burping and all sorts of sick shit. i convinced myself over and over and over that i was going to cut this short, call it a day at 3, but i didn't. so that, combined with it being dark (9:30 pm) and lightning out; it took a lot of will power and a little stupidity to not be a pussy tonight.
kinda strange, thought i was going quicker than this, but no big deal. got in the miles. had to from from the auto shop, so i never really knew where i was at for distance.

i really gotta work on the eating prerun. i guess i cant expect much running from my grandma's, but skittles, twizzlers, chocolate covered graham crackers and mikes hard lemonade doesnt exactly sit well right before running.
I've had better, I've had worse. at least it wasnt hot out.

first 2 miles or so i did really slow, then i started feeling surprisingly good. picked it up over the last 1.5, and in the last mile, it was dusk, i was running on the long gravel road between corn fields, old houses, horse pens, and irrigators; i felt absolutely phenominal. my own tobacco road. i threw in a couple pick ups, and i felt unstoppable.

pretty darn good run.
rainy, felt good.

just stayed as relaxed as i could. got up at 6 - didnt actually get out of bed till 6:30- to do this one, as the heat index is supposed to be over 100 today. anyway, it was 73 degrees and 97% humidity when i started, so i was a little concerned about what would happen as the clouds burned off and the sun got higher. luckily the temp rose slowly, and became only a mild nuisance. considering the humidity, i was happy that my shorts lasted 9 miles before becoming entirely saturated, and luckily a stashed a bottle of water and some vaseline around mile 10, so i got there, lubed up the thighs and armpits, drank some water, poured the rest on myself, and it cooled me fairly well. about a mile after that i had to stop and pee, luckily the bathroom by the lock and dam was open, so i used it, and i used the hand dryer to semi-dry my shorts/body. decent route - did the standard route, but instead of taking the presidents' streets to 4th and in,  i swung wide, went out to jerry path, and then looped through 'back in time' to jacob and in, which was 18.2, then i kicked of my shoes and finished it off barefoot. much much better than last week, i probably had 3 or 4 more miles in me before i hit the wall, unlike last week hitting the wall at 13. I think it helped not doubling last night, and eating an entire pan (minus one slice) of meatloaf and half a box of mac n' cheese before bed last night. nothing like a 2000 calorie bedtime snack, and then still weighing 145 in the morning. now a half day of work and im free for the evening!

today was a good day.

felt pretty good today. super hot out, so i got up at 6:30 to run, but was had to take my car in to the shop blah blah blah anyway, I couldn't find my keys so i didnt get running till 7:20. Getting pretty toasty by the time I finished.

today's run puts me over 1000 for the summer so far. I'm not gonna put the cart before the horse, nor will I commit to anything right now, but I'm off work wed-sunday and as good as last weeks 112 felt, I may just have to make that last jump... ;)

F this route. no possible way is it only 5.07. i'm gonna drive it and figure this out. i mean, i wasnt flying, but a did split the only mile i know out there exactly (2.5 to 3.5) and i was at 6:55. stupid mapmyrun.

just remapped it and got 5.13

still not sure about it, but it's closer.
started slow, felt really good, little tired at the end.

really rolling in the middle, as it was storming - and it's amazing what a few close-by lightning bolts will do to ones motivation.

planned on 7, cut the loop to 5, and then added on 1 when i finally realized i probably wouldn't get struck.
easy pace, hips a little sore. 93% humidity again.
ran from the schutt's house. again, planned on going more, but i fel guilty just leaving mikey working on my car by himself, so i flipped it early and went back.

SO FREAKING HOT! i'm incredibly sick of running in soaking wet shorts. and im just generally irritable because of the mileage, and the fact that i was up till 2am working on my car, and then had to get up and run at 7. i just want to be done with that stupid thing and have my life back. Fuck you GM and your corrosive DEX-Cool coolant. You think i'm paying one of your bitches $800 to replace a $20 gasket? I'm not falling for your sales tactics...
storming and i felt like crap cuz of all the pizza, so i cut it short. stress is getting to me. i'm behind where i wanted to be.

my legs are really really getting tired of this calculated brutalization that im doing to them. felt like crap after being on my feet all day yesterday and 2nd night in a row of <5 hrs='' of=''></5>

on the plus side, im in the best shape of my life i guess.
2 barefoot. just getting it in. feeling kinda tired.

first of all, #1 on the top 20. fuck yeah.

second, before i get 9000 comments about how i need to settle down so i dont burn out, know that this wasnt intentional. I was gonna take a down day, 10 miles, today, and then run long tomorrow, but since tomorrow im gonna be in the middle of nowhere wisconsin on a road with no shoulders, i figured 3 miles in to todays run that i'd swap the days, as i was feeling pretty good today. 

that having been said, i cant believe i'm at 130.5 in 7 days, and over 105 are in singles. seems unreal. now i know how dan greeno feels, minus the faster paces, awards, and actually respectable pr's.

as i thought i'd be going short today, i didnt get started till 8:45, so by the time i finished i was soaked and it was so freakin hot... but i just kept the pace really slow. really slow. now a down day tomorrow, and coast through next week to get a little recovered for early camp. 8 days away!

went really easy on the way out, normal effort on the way back. ran up by gordon wisconsin form earl and danny's. not too hot out, even kept the shirt on for the first quarter mile. there was a loop around the lake i was going to do that was supposedly about 10, but i didn't trust earl's judgement enough to keep looking for the turn, so at about 36 minutes when i still couldnt see it on the horizon, i just flipped it and made it an out and back. really small curvy road, definitely the hilliest run of summer thus far. i dont know if it was ever flat, actually. 

legs felt pretty tired, but i got through it. 120 on the week seems a lot less awesome when you just had 130 in 6. really really pretty, scenic run. love hanging out at the cabins.

in hindsight, im glad i swapped today and saturday though.

little quick the first half, rolled the second. just felt strong and my legs felt kinda poppy, so i just let them do their thing.

today it was 56 degrees when i woke up, and for the first time since school i actually thought, 'i'm gonna wait for it to warm up' so i watched the sun come over the lake, drank some coffee, had about a 45 minute conversation explaining the science of everything from genetics and cloning, to hydrology and digestion to william (4) and olivia (7), which proved quite interesting. awesome, relaxing morning overall

Gonna just coast this week, so i can be feeling good during the early camp push. i dont know what that means exactly, but i hand the reigns back to you lupprXC.

started slow, maybe 7:20 or 30, finished in  6:40's. 

legs didn't feel good til mile 8 or 9, i suppose because of all the hills the last 2 days. that and my shoes are already crap for some reason.

started slow - first 1.5 was at 7:30 pace (legs were tight starting out, and i really need new shoes) then i went down to 6:40's, and closed in 6:13.

nice and cool out.
felt good the first half, right hip was sore the second. last full day of work!
i felt like crap today, but it was a strange type of terrible. i had to get up for work at 4, and work from 4:45-noon, and then go running which threw off my schedule.
got new shorts/shoes today. ran in 2-pairs-ago old ones though. felt good.
a little tired, but felt really comfortable today.

ran with max around hastings. sweet run, and great conversation. then we had ice cream and sat and talked till almost 11. good times, im excited to see what he can do when he's actually at a good school.

felt kinda tired, but alright - was going to do a short long run today but just wasnt feeling it so i bagged it pretty early on. early camp starts tomorrow! 2 weeks of running, hanging out, and eating free food. sweet.
run around town with kuhn. good run, almost camp time!

my legs have never been this locked before. i shuffled through the mile. going right from bed to the roads never has worked for me. the sole purpose of this run was to put myself over 1200 miles on the summer before i check in at camp today.

summer total: 1200.53 miles in 13 weeks and one day.

one day off

average miles/day: 13.19

average pace: 6:52

Total time run: 137:25:29

so flippin hot...

85, sunny, humid, no wind.

but i doubt anyone in the conference can say they ran 1200 miles this summer? bring it.

back at camp, and love running with the guys.
felt terrible
up in lutsen, cool weather, scenic trails. probably over 10 but i dont know what else to call it

warm up on the trail, 15, 10, 5 minute AT run - around 5:25 pace as we got going.

felt good
double on the trails. had to poop everywhere. 1 mile barefoot
sore starting out, really smooth towards the end.
solo double run on the trails. no one wanted to come with. wonder why...?
about 40 minutes after my double. Tom wanted to go for a shakeout, but i was too delirious to explain the trail route to him and it seemed less effort-ful to just run with him than explain it.

on the pavement in lutsen, 3 mile warmup, 5,10,5 threshold with 3 minutes recovery. kept it honest the first 5 and the 10, but then rolled the second. pulled away a bit from the team head coach brenden came with. at 3 minutes brenden told me to take a shot so i dropped into whatever my highest gear at the moment was, and then with a minute to go he said 'one more' and i drove even harder, and i knew all i had left was my sprint turnover, and with 10 seconds left he said to use it up and i blasted it. basing off of tuesday's 5:25 pace, i'm going to guess this one ended up around 4:45 pace at the end. 2.5 cooldown.

after this run the girls team... cough*runs 2 miles a day*cough had eaten all the breakfast food so all i got was a spoon full of strawberry jam and a protein shake.
felt pretty sluggish today, never truly loosened up. ice bath after.
run with delaubs, leaf, and the professor. good runs, feels strange that i'm only a year away from being in their shoes.

5k alumni race in the arb. course was insanely slow, and that coupled with the fact that i was off on my own and took a wrong turn and added about 300 meters to the course meant i got 9th and 17:01. i came around the interpretative center and saw everyone cutting across the field... thought they were cutting the course, but then i saw the flags and realized my mistake. fell in line, kicked down thornton, but couldnt get anyone else. sad day, but kuhn wanted us to know that he beat me. oh well. i felt stong, and i know i'm ready to roll chumps.

anyway, we figure i ran about 16:30 for the day, which on the arb course is plenty fast, though i realize it doesn't sound like much.

a pretty interesting run, body-wise. my legs felt awesome, and my body felt awesome till about mile 12, and then i really had to focus on my breathing to keep the side aches at bay. so that sucked. i definitely didnt have enough salt in my system, and since it was so hot drinking all the water just probably kept diluting what little i did have even more. challenge today, which added to the slow pace im sure.

also, left my shoes in my locker and lund wasnt open so i had to run in old shoes. they felt fine though.
12-8-5 threshold with 2 min. recovery. went fast, felt good.
hotter than hot. 90 degrees, 80+ percent humidity. needless to say no one else wanted to go, and we had a pool workout after, so i did a solo run. 3 on the roads, 2 barefoot.
quite the night last night**, little sluggish, but made it fine.
just a morning shake out
pace was pretty slow today, wanted some recovery and the cuts on my feet were pretty painful.
started out super slow, was at or below 7 minute pace from mile 2 on. just a little hard to will my body forward sometimes.

felt great today. and it was freshman move in day so we ran through the parade of greeters and frosh's. it was sweet. 9 am and people were already drinking on the corners to show the new kids what GAC is all about.
after china town buffet, so sick.

This run sucked and here's why:

Went to bed around midnight, slept till 2, layed there till 3 something, got up and went goose hunting. we got 18 which was sweet, but carrying blinds/decoys/walking around in boots made my legs feel super heavy. that, and all i wanted to do was sleep, but at about 11 or 11:30 mark and i kicked out this run. whilst out on said run we ran by the rendering plant where they turn roadkill into dogfood. i cannot explain this smell - except that it was the worst smell i've ever experienced. i nearly lost my cookies, i felt trapped by it; helpless. quite the experience.

one of the more awesome runs in a while. i felt moderately terrible the whole time, but some adventures happened today. the minnesota river is at it's highest point in history i believe, and all 4 highways in and out of town (169 north, 169 south, 22, and 99) are all closed, making us essentially an island right now. water is over the roads, the bridges... I figure, hey we can still run in town and be ok. we go do trailer bark backwards, and once we get past the state hospital, the road is flooded. I didnt want to run a mile out of my way to get around it, but it was flooded for ~200m. so me, eric, bartley, and lund take off our shoes and much in the fashion of the poor bastards on oregon trail, we start fording the river. we're walking down the road (ankle deep water) and it gets deeper and deeper till it's up to my armpits and bartley is doing the sidestroke, literally swimming down the road in the middle of our run. he kept 'stepping on snakes' as well as snappers and carp, and it was hilarious. then we ran, basically, to every other flooded roadway to check it out. I wonder where the deer go at times like this, or if they just tread water.... i know where the snakes went, all over the roads. dozens of them, like nightcrawlers after a rain. pretty memorable run today.

hill route up on the hill instead of switchbacks cuz of the flooding. hit the hills hard, crested, then recovered between them. felt ok today, not great, but not horrible. i just wasnt in it mentally or something.

sweet. biggest blizzard that i can remember today.

windchills around -30, town is closed down, and me, kurt, mark, kuhn, andi, nina, and brooke were all trapped in my apartment. everything covered in ice and a few feet of snow. so i decide at 9:15 to run to econofoods and get some drink mix so we can have a daquari or margarita party/movie night. well the store was open, but the liquor store portion wasnt, so i got some peanut butter M&M's, ran to my car, and drove back to campus. people were traying down college ave hill. Unreal. not a single street was plowed except 169, and that was only kinda plowed. then i got up to campus by some act of god, to realize that every parking lot was snowed in. so i drove back into town, got my car stuck right in the middle of mullberry street. a few kind mexicans in a truck offered to get me out, but i thought i could do it. after shoveling tons of snow with my hands, and making 6 inch improvements, i finally got out. it took almost a half tank of gas. I left it at econo foods and ran up grace street hill, in 10 inches of snow, against 25 mph winds, in the freezing, snowing, cold. saw 1 other car the whole time. damned if i'm not getting these 2 miles out of this ordeal.

historically the longest run done on the Gustavus indoor track. about 106 laps to best the old record by 6. ran the whole thing in lunars, felt relatively good. had some extensive bleeding from my right toes by the end though, causing the forefoot of my shoe to be a nice shade of crimson
first 6 miles or so in flats. all on the indoor track again... -11 felt like -24. gotta get out of this state.
morning run on the indoor

another run on the indoor. there's a half inch of ice on all the roads, and since it hasnt been over 10 degrees since friday, none of the snow is melting. my body needs a break from those turns, badly.

roads are unbelievable. layer of ice covered in a layer of powder. and it's its going no where fast. i fall flat on my back with a mile to go, and bartley flags down cars - not because he thinks I need help - he just wants them to share in the comedy of the moment with him, so I got laughed at by a mom and some other chick. hilarious. Then, inside of a mile to go, we're running down sunrise and this car drives by and honks. naturally, I flip them off, and continue on my way. 5 minutes later the car comes back, pulls along side me and rolls down the window. the approximately 17-18 year old driver with his girlfriend in the passenger seat leans out and says 'I'll put you in a snowbank you faggots' not realizing that fighting someone on a run has been my dream for 4 years and bartley is a world champ wrestler. So I say everything I can to get him to stop. I tell him to pull over, get out, come back, etc... I tell him to come over and talk about this. he continues down the road and pulls in to the high school track parking lot.

recently, bartley has been dying to do some MMA and Anderson Silva someone in the jaw, so I look at him and ask if hes down for a fight. He complies, and now i'm 100% to destroy this kid, and then offer to take his girlfriend on a date. we get up by the parking lot and he pulls out, flips us off and drives away.

In retrospect I should have insulted his gf, as then he'd have to stop to defend her honor. however, she must already think he's an immature tool for acting that way, and insulting her would have decreased my chances of making out with her while bartley forced her turd boyfriend to watch.

2004 silver nissan ultima, i'm watching for you.

i'm at a crossroads with this sport. The weather here is so bad that I feel stuck. Running 7 miles a day doesn't make me motivated to run more, so i feel like there's nothing to build or maintain, but then I dont even feel like going to practice cuz what's the point in running 7 miles? it's SOOOOO pussy. But the roads are so terrible my body couldnt handle all the slipping for more than 5 miles, and my hips cant take the track anymore. so then what? I just stopped in the middle of my run today and sat sulking on a bench.

I don't believe in this mediocre training, but days like today I had absolutely no options. all the treadmills were full, the track hurts, the roads hurt the most. there is zero traction. I honestly want to be done with running today.

9 on the indoor, 1 on the treadmill. after mile 5 I asked mark if he wanted to do a fast mile, mostly as a joke. He said yes, and we stopped an rested for about 30 seconds. I was thinking like... 5:30-5:50, but he just took off. i figured early on i wasnt going to race him, or kick, or really exert myself much, but we still both went sub 5, kinda surprising seeing as there is a basketball hoop in lanes 1 and 2, and I have zero fitness right now. pretty easy actually.

Up at 8 am, packed my bags and came home, Spent the day at the hospital, grandma is in the ICU, then went straight to pick val up from the airport, coming home from spain, got home at 9 pm, having not eaten in over 24 hours. I hate taking the day, but today I really had no choice. sucky, but I'll get it tomorrow.

props to dakota county and the city of hastings, all the roads were COMPLETELY clear, and the trails were even plowed. Fuck nicollett county. St. Peter blows. Pretty warm today, somewhere between 10 and 14, and just a light breeze. went out to back in time - love that route. EVERY SINGLE PERSON i saw out there waved. one guy even came out of his house to wish me happy holidays. And I saw maybe too good looking of a girl with a horse. I think she liked me. anyway, got into the heart of town, met kelly, turned around and finished her run with her. pretty decent run. still a huge wuss this week.
slow run, but the effort was there. Winter storm warning, couldn't keep my eyes open it was snowing so hard. running through shoe deep snow the whole way.

roads were mostly clear, but spotty. first 10 miles i did kinda a fartlek, picking it up where it was clear, then slowing where it was snowy/slick. at 10 miles, the trail from the dam, across the lock, and up eagle bluff hill was under 6 inches of snow, plus drifts - so that crushed my 'workout' i just trotted through that. figured I felt pretty good today, and I'll get in the miles when I can. Got hit on by a car full of high school girls, which, of course, is always appreciated.

my big toe hurt - like the bone/joint. a little concerned about my feet right now. I hope there are no fractures.

FINALLY! winter took a day off. 33 degrees, 10 mph winds, mix of sun and clouds. just threw on compression shorts, a t-shirt with a long sleeve over it, and was still sweating like mad. probably should have two longer runs back to back this early on, but you gotta make hay when the sun shines right? It supposed to snow the next two days and then get cold again, So I did what I could today. fairly enjoyable run. still feel like i'm lacking a little strength, and I definitely need new shoes. If the sun would have been out the whole time I could have gotten away with shorts. Days like this are so much better than those piddle dick 8 mile runs....

the college dream backfired a little. jterm = no classes, so we partied last night, woke up, had coffee, went running, went to chinatown buffet, me mark and delaubs took a nearly 2 hour nap to sleep the food off, woke up, had more coffee, and went running again. the chinese buffet was way better feeling at lunch than at practice.

little short on time after the mankato meet. delaubs had a pretty motivating finish. wish i could have carried the adrenaline into this run. pretty spent, decent shakeout though.

0 degrees, but no wind, so not too bad. slow for the first 8 or 9, then started rolling, around mile 12 i decided to just drop back and relax a bit. first 15 with leaf, kurt and bartley, last 2 alone. I've had better long runs. my bones/joints hurt.

crappiest run in a while. little over 2 on the indoor, but after dodging sprinters, getting pissed, and being forced to hurdle a pole vaulter's pole last second i said fuck it and went out in the whiteout snow. out and back road was indistinguishable from the fields on either side. looped outside, came back in and did 2 on the treadmill, then piddle dicked around on the indoor doing some strides and working on some pacing stuff with some 200's.

went way past where anyone has ever gone in ottowa. ran from the apartment to pizza ranch in Le Seuer via ottowa road. Pretty skimpy long run, but the buffet closes at 2, and I got there at 1:20. awesome run, awesome day. Had a beer at the bar before Nina brought us home.

That being said, we're pretty skeptical of the deer on this run. They had it in for us. saw tons, and not only did they try to flank us, they also chased us, followed us, cut us off. The theory is that they live in the houses. Apparently there is a mythical creature out past ottowa called the lantern man. He'd have come for us, but he was in church we decided. the power lines were trying to communicate with bartley's foot in alien language. stories stories stories...
pretty slick roads, but i felt good today minus the weird sloshyness. taking a bit of a down week this week to give the body a slight break. supposed to get pretty cold this week.

solo workout, kinda strange one, feel like i worked hard but never ran close to fast, definitely feel like i wimped out. 5k race sim, continuous, the only recovery is every other repeat (usually 200) at threshold pace. so not much recovery.

strongest I've felt in a long time. made up a workout that would cause me to run a lot of different paces and distances, and then see if i could hold race pace for a long interval at the end. Would have liked to have ended with a mile, but decided for the first time doing this that a 1000 was ok.

Had to get on with the day. Felt pretty darn good actually, and ran the whole thing in flats, because running in my trainers make my foot SCREAM in pain. must be a form thing. flats didn't hurt at all.
foot hurt, and this damn blizzard... I was pressed for time and crabby this morning.
felt much better than this morning.

surprisingly a tough workout. Big thanks to Henderson for taking me on for now. 20x400 with 1 minute of recovery at 5k effort. The hardest part was the recovery - trying to get the breathing and heart rate under control that quick was a challenge. Running on the outside of lane 1 cuz the nets were down and going out to lane 3 every lap for the basketball hoop wasn't much fun either though I guess. easy morning run

such a baller run. really wasn't looking forward to his, but I wasn't sore or uncomfortable for a single step. even the first 20 seconds I felt warmed up, fluid and loose for some reason. Wont complain about that. 7 minute miles for the first 2, then dropped to 6:35's for the rest, and at mile 5 even the 6:35 pace felt so ludicrously easy that i put the incline at 3.5 for 2 miles just so i could sweat a little, feel like i was actually doing something. ran miles 7-10 @ 6:30 pace and 0 incline, and felt like i was running downhill. kinda neat. finished with 4x1:00 @ 14 mph (4:16 pace), although i put the wheel on the treadmill and determined that at '14 mph' it's actually going 4:06 pace. i'm sure friction of a runner slows it down some though. after the initial flurry of quick strides at that pace i was actually able to run at that speed and feel relaxed, so after the season is over I'm going to try to hold on for a mile at full speed. not having to push off (forward) makes running on a treadmill so much easier than running on real ground. I think I can weather the storm for 4:10... we'll see I guess.

Solid, good run today.

i was hoping to run about 5:07 pace, but as it turns out even 5:07 isn't exactly the stroll in the park that I thought it was. Sounds laughable, but I misjudged the pace, and instead of running 6:24's for the 2k's, I ran 6:30, 6:29. still fine, but come on....

part of the problem was the track traffic, and the guy in the wheelchair PARKED in lane one on the curve. came through the mile both times around 5:11 or 5:12. the pace was awkward, cuz it was faster than threshold pace but slower than any track work ive done so far. It was hard to mentally 'get up' for it, since I knew I'd be essentially glorified-ly jogging out there. oh well. at least it was easy. kinda.

morning bridges backwards with marbar. Almost died when a truck went right through an intersection. stop sign, crosswalk, and i was wearing my orange running jacket. I was inches away and mark had to jump into the snowbank since he was behind me even.

Funny part is, we just laughed. We've long since decided and come to terms with dying that way.
felt too good. wore shorts. 30 degrees and no wind.  ran after abnormal psych with marbar and kuhn. great run
good first 5 mile, then my IT band got a little iffy. opened up to threshold pace the last 800m, mile pace the last 200. felt really good, efficient, fast.

felt so good. 39, windchill of 30, pretty strong winds, but the sun was shining and i had on compression shorts and a long sleeve shirt - just felt like spring. the run was easy, light, free... i felt like a kid just frolicking around the whole time. smooth, good day.

Cold, windy as heck out so I stayed on the indoor track. This run was all I did today. Literally. somewhere around mile 5 some little girl, maybe 10 years old jumped in with us to race us for a lap. she got maybe 30 meters ahead (we didn't pick it up at all) when I decided I should probably run her down. I caught her on the last curve and asked her to race. she agreed, and we decided the first person to touch the pole vault mat wins. a kick to the finish ensued, and after reviewing the finishing video, and times to the thousandth place, she did, in fact, beat me.

last 3 laps: 38, 35, 31. felt really good again. strong day.

averaged 5:48 for the 40 minutes. no thanks to the golfball knot in my upper right hamstring. holy ouch. felt pretty crippling out there, had to walk the end of my cooldown. may or may not run on it tomorrow. i hate to say that, and i wanted to start back into real mileage, but it's too early to ruin my season.
Right hamstring was knotted and crippling. I'm sick of these empty days on the training log, but today it had to be done. even walking is a chore.

easy run coming back from this hamstring issue. Considered going farther, but didn't want to push my luck. It never hurt, or became an issue, but i could tell the whole time that it was just waiting at bay throughout the run. Definitely not 100% gone yet. we'll see how it feels tomorrow - I may or may not do the hill workout.

I dont know how far this actually was. did the lactate threshold for poff today in the health science lab. pretty cool if it weren't for having my fingers pricked every 3 minutes to test my blood. I was at full speed, 6% incline, and my lactate never got over 7, so they couldn't make it spike. after 42 minutes poff said he couldn't waste more strips on me. after he convinced me no one made it as far/long as i did without spiking, i got off.

This explains why it's never my legs, and always my lungs that hold me back in racing.

interesting, half-hearted long run. Pretty slow getting going this morning, and Mark and I more or less stumbled out the door. it was in the low 30's, windchill of 25, winds 22mph gusting to 36. winter in may. ridiculous. we figured we'd just hodge podge around town, and somehow it turned out that the wind was ALWAYS at our backs. God is merciful. then down on bridges I saw a six pack plastic ring thing hanging from a tree with a beer can in it. after a few steps I stopped, because no one puts empties back in the rings. It was off the road in the trees across where it was flooded. Mark and I walked across the mud and water, and the beer can was full and unopened. Again, God is merciful. Anytime a flood carries away a beer and deposits it at mile 9, you take it. So mark and I drank it on the side of the road. Then we adventure ran around the bridges area, got lost in the arb, found some chairs, went off roading, and called it a day. Such a weak week mileage wise, but whatever. A good race, and a fun semi-long run.
easy. felt really good.

shooting for 3:40's but after the first rep the wind really picked up and I wasn't going to strain to get there. that wasn't the point of this workout. I'll keep my carrots planted, thank you. Still a little disappointed in how I fell off. tore a huge hole in my matumbo's. that's cool.

3:41, 3:43, 3:43, 3:44
holy sideaches. don't know how far this actually was. gotta be close to 5 though.
sucky, sucky morning run. really nice out, but my shins/joints/rest of me just wasn't having it.

2x2miles at tempo pace. around 5:40's out on rabbit road. 3 minutes jogging between

built this easy run day into my schedule in case I followed through with racing this weekend. Driving to the cities and back again just is getting to cost too much, and I don't feel like I'm ready to run anything remarkable yet. I'd rather just train and hit Last chance hard, than go run a 15:45 or something today.

last run with the team as a whole, as a lot of them will end their seasons tomorrow. so per tradition, I stashed a cooler of beer in the arb, and we all went and had a toast at the end of the run. While I'm not thrilled with what I've done here, today's run - maybe it was just the nice weather - made me really reflect on how far I've actually come in college. I ran across the starting line in the arb from my first college race (less UND) and remembered being that out of shape dreamer with the 18:30 5k pr and 37 something in the 10k. maybe my trials haven't been so fruitless. and who knows. maybe there'll be more after I leave this place.

forwent the racing today.

8x200 w/200m recovery - about 90 seconds
no real goal time in mind. about 95% effort I'd say.

around town plus some arb and barefoot  with leaf. some good chats about life, love, and pathological lying. Always good to run with JL. looking forward to his impending wedding.

mile time trial.

alone, 45 feels like 37, raining, 18 mph wind. I DIDN'T want to do this.

Quite a bit about the Triangle, Henderson, and what to do with life after this. Good run overall - was going to go 13, but thought F it, I'm going to enjoy this warmth and walk back to campus from hartmans house. so I did. and it was good.
ottowa plus a mile on the grass. legs feel good, but i had to poop 4 times. stopped at mile 2 at the pond by the train tracks on 99 and caught some carp with my hands, cut my toe... sunny, nice day.
