max came to campus, and wanted to run 35 minutes so i thought wtf and went with him.
all bar run. The time for this run was the the amount of time i spent drinking drinks, not running. And it should be longer, but i eventually stopped remembering to start my watch.

So either I'm getting old and senile, or the kids of the Hastings community are getting worse. I got laughed at, called names, etc. repeatedly today. Also, on the kennedy bike trail I saw a kid - probably early high school age - rolling a joint or something. I came around the corner and he freaked out. grabbed all his stuff and in a panic stuffed it in a pocket and biked away. Like the doesn't look obvious. As for the kids all mocking me, it may be, perhaps, that I'm currently flabby and slow and am not as physically intimidating as when I'm in shape and fast. Not that anyone really notices the difference.

As for the running, I've gone soft. My first mile felt like i was doing an easy tempo workout. just in the sense that my turnover felt quick and my footstrike felt light. split my first mile and it was 7:12. I knew it's be  tough day from there. by mile 2 i almost had to stop, and from there I survival shuffled the rest of the way.
ouch

another slow day. On better note, I'm confident I could run a 6 minute mile right now. Go me.

On a lesser note. This is one of the worst days of my life. Made me really reconsider what I consider significant. I can't even count how many times I questioned why I'm running again. Maybe I'll go tomorrow, Maybe fuck this. Part of me wants to give up, buy my one way ticket out of this state and see what's going on somewhere out west.
because what the fuck else do I have to do.

just something to fill the little white square.
last 3 miles 6:41, 6:07, 5:50
hot. terrible.
nothing in my soul could get me to run today. end of story.

early morning run over in riverfalls with kyle donovan and T.O. 2 laps of the mountain bike trails, which was nice cuz it was all in the woods/shade, and it was flippin hot. nice to run on dirt for once. Got offered a spot on Gear West's team. food for thought.
just slow and easy out and back. the last mile was probably sub 7

tried to stay relaxed, but my right hip/butt hurt. have to keep an eye on it. got up at 6am to avoid the heat and it was already 74. Looks like the high is 95 with a heat index over 100 today. HOpefully I can sneak in a short run after the sun goes down. Until then I'll sit in the air conditioning and pray for the souls of the Amish.

got up to 105 degrees today. I actually tried frying an egg on hood of my car. I believe my sister took pictures - so if there was any doubt I was a hillbilly before, well, here ya go.

still about 96 went I went at 9:30, and really had to will myself through it. Short run, just trying to get used to the 2x day routine again.

didn't start running till 8:15, so it was already 81 when I took off. felt surprisingly good today. bees, pleasant, dam straight to 5th, tyler around cp and in plus to hackberry and back.

I believe, in all my years running in this town, today was the first time I ever ran UP cp adam's hill.

it was actually getting chilly out, and I was feeling antsy. I wore my flats, just to get out of the trainers for a run. Anyhow, maybe it's psychological, maybe it's how the flats allow for a feel of the road, maybe it's cuz my feet are lighter, I dont know, but after running 7:10 pace for the first half mile, This run became an improvised tempo. the first section (3.04 miles) to vermillion street averaged 5:38 pace, not bad for starting slow. Once across vermillion, the last 2.04 miles averaged 5:31 pace (not bad considering this whole stretch is up hill), meaning I would have split about 27:35 for the 8k. really relaxed, felt good. at least I know I have something of speed still. never went 100% just locked in at about 80% and cruised.
another run.

Knew this run would be bad before I started. Didn't want to go, spent the last mile stopping every minute convinced I was going to puke. legs were fine but the cheesy BBQ chicken quesadilla I ate 90 minutes prior made my stomach a world of sick. so gross.

Locked into my 7:20 effort jog, and just turned my brain off. Did the anti-dam 11 plus an out and back add on at the end. Right calf still a bit sore, presumably from the wednesday night tempo. Felt pretty decent today.
one more chance at getting hit by a car. My life is like a morbid raffle.
up by 6, contemplated life for however long it took the dryer to dry my shorts, then out the door I went.

first and last 4 miles on pavement, between that I ran the Shopco trails in River Falls with Donovan. That motherf*cker is fit. those trails are ruthless. they make Griak feel like an airport runway. CONSTANTLY going up or down, all dirt, and he had me breathing hard while he was just chatting away. probably hit just under 7's on the trails, 6:30ish on the roads.
started slow, gradually picked it up. last 4 miles barefoot around 6:30 pace.
in minneapolis with kurt and marb. 2 barefoot. felt fast, but tired.
in minneapolis with mark. legs felt pretty garbagey. didn't exactly eat healthily yesterday and my body wasn't used to it. oh well. I also suspect this run to be slightly over 10.
legs felt SO much better than this morning. Pouring rain, lightning. Again, my life is just a morbid raffle and I'm buying a million tickets.

felt really good. I was trying to run Standard 10, but it's been so long that I forgot exactly how it went. I looped through president's streets and I guess I don't have to do that. Saw a huge snapping turtle down on the dike, about twice the size of a basketball. stopped and sat with it for a while. Im sure that looked normal. Air smelled like my youth by lake rebecca today. the right mix of dampness and fish and wet wood and algae and black walnuts... reminded me of all the adventuresome fishing outings that Dave and I had down there. Misted on me for the last 5 miles.
felt awful. Ate way too close to this run, and after puking in the back of my mouth a half dozen times I figured I'll fight through miles some day when it sucks less. cut it short.
felt like such garbage. legs tired, will weak. Every day can't be the best day.

felt great. much better than this morning, so I did a farlek type of thing, mostly short fast sprints... something like 1 block at mile pace or faster with a block recovery, but just went when I felt like it. Got heckled at least a dozen times, and I never shouted back, but the last one happened as I was crossing the wood bridge at vermillion falls - 2 couples were walking together when one of the guys said something about 'ass hanging out of your shorts' and his girlfriend said, 'shut up, he's better looking than you are' to her bf. made my day, held it together till I got around the corner and then nearly died laughing. Good run.
guts felt funny. but legs were fine, hot out.
felt fine. humid out, and no motivation.
so humid that the air was hazy. then it rained for the last 3 miles. my joints kinda hurt.
felt really strange during this run. was only going to go 15, but I felt pretty strong so I went a little more.
boring. Didn't want to run. just getting in the miles a little.
felt easy. went quick. Had some interesting thoughts out there today, but they escape me at the moment. Maybe they'll come back.

early morning workout. Nothing strenuous, just something to get moving a little.

3 mile tempo, 2x800 @ 2:30's

3 miles in 16:14, 2:32, 2:29

felt really good. kept it slow.

It was just like fall out there today. everything was perfect. overcast, 54 degrees, the air smelled like old leaves and wet sod... felt just like a cross country meet - my only complaint today is I woke up to some coffee my mom made, and it was 'half-caf' (half-caffeine of reg. coffee) wtf kind of fence-sitting bs is that? either be decaf, or regular ya know? come on... sh*t or get off the pot. That's what I say.
form felt off. legs were sloppy. probably from standing a lot at work.
I need to quit hating running so much while I'm out there. Beautiful day.

in RF. I guess I wont be doing a long run this week - which isn't all together terrible, since it is a down week, and I upped the intensity a bit. I was planning on 15-17, by by 6 miles Kyle was done - and I don't know enough about RF to run another 10 miles solo so I added on to make it 10, and I'm  planning to go again tonight to make up the difference. Then back to high mileage next week. We'll see how that goes with working every day now.
speed walking? Chafing sucks. I caught a tree frog though. that was pretty sweet.
felt good
on the grass. didn't really wanna..
felt fine. just wanted to be done.
not the worst night run ever.
a true zero effort run. just jogged around a new route today. It shall be called orbit. this was the first run in a week or so that I didn't chafe. felt good, felt easy. good morning.

Was going to do 5x1 mile with a minute of recovery @ 10kish pace, but then it decided to be a heat wave today. so I went to RF and ran with donovan and Scott Bowman out at shopko trails to stay in the shade. We picked it up to tempo after 4 or so miles, then back down at them end. Scott's watch said 10.25, Dono said 10.5, but I'm a skeptic. I wanted to add on with Bowman to get 12 and not run tonight, but I figured it'd be best if I doubled, so i cut it at ten. I still MIGHT not run tonight, but then I'd have to go farther tomorrow. We'll see what the weather is like later on. felt pretty remarkable given the temps and pace.
91 degrees. enough said.
shopco with brooke. Heat really wasn't bad in the woods, or the first two miles of the out and back.
really flipping hot. my week's plan got a little shaken up after last night's huge storm
barefoot, felt good. strides after.
first 6 miles easy around 6:50. next 5.91 miles kinda an easy progression averaging 6:11's, then easy the rest of the way.
conned my mom into biking with me. hot out, but I actually felt really good. really good. bees, cp, cowtown, dam, pleasant, southview, 31st to century to 36 to cannon.

worst day of work ever. hard to decompress a bit. Imagine the worst possible scenario involving poop, laundry detergent, trail mix, mop water, a suppository,  me, and an autistic man - and I promise you what actually happened was worse.
don't know how this happened. i was crawling for the first 8 miles.
soooo slow.

10-5-10-5 tempo. 

right around 5:15 pace. felt fine, as in I wasn't tired or anything, but it was hot and I felt like I didn't have much for speed endurance.
jogging2finish.com

Friiiiiiiiiick. up to run at 5:30 after less than 5 hours of sleep, then to work. so much caffeine today. I closed my eyes at mile 8 in this run and I could have 100% no question fell asleep out running.
In the last 42 hours I've run 33 miles, worked 16 hours, and slept for 5. my body felt like trash tonight.
Hot out. not a bad run all together though.

up in minneapolis with the guys team. wanted to be done by the end, but felt good overall
.
ran slow cuz it was SO hot out. shins hurt a bit, ice bath after.
I cannot in good conscience believe this run to be 10 miles.

after work, legs felt really good and snappy, so I decided to do the 5-4-3-2-1 minute workout. however, it was right after eating about a 2 pound fajita and numerous mexican (kurt) sides. My stomach THROBBED the whole time and probably detracted from the workout. about 5:10 pace for the 5 minutes, don't know about the rest, but i was flooring it during the 1 minute.
nothing like 5 am.

One of those runs where everything just clicked. form felt SUPER efficient, my legs felt infinitely strong, and I just floated. We'll call runs like this Ristau runs from now on, cuz I felt like I was running the way that Marbar describs RIstau. huge floating effortless strides that just cover tons of ground. progressed through the first 7.17 miles averaging 6:27, but was def going sub 6's by the end. great run.
nice weather. good run.
really really slow. Cut back tonight and just did a shakeout in case I go for the 5/5/5 15 mile progression tomorrow. 3 telephone pole fartlek pick ups at the end.

5/5/5 15 mile progression.

got up at 5:10 to run this, and it was pouring so I went back to bed and resolved to run it on the treadmills later. Got up again at 7:30 and it wasn't raining so I went outside and started it. Was a lot easier physically than I thought it'd be. I really mentally psyched myself out for this one. took my 5 miles splits:

35:29 
28:36
27:10

Really wanted to hit 26:40 for the last 5 miles, but it was pouring by this point, and there were a few resonable hills in the last 5 miles. not 30 seconds worth, but worth mentioning. at least I know I can break 60. Unofficial 10 mile pr today... 55:46.

Just tried to keep it relaxed and quick. stayed pretty relaxed till 13.5, then things started to get a little sloppy.
easy run in the mf rain again. 7:30's out, 7's back. Just ran super easy to get whatever recovery my legs need.
slow. had heartburn pretty bad.
around town with brooke

only went 6 just to make sure I'd at least have 100 this week. I don't feel like i HAVE to be higher than that, but I may run again tonight weather depending. The heat index is almost 110 degrees today - so these 6 miles felt like 20. the next fel days are all supposed to be this hot, and only get down to 80 overnight. Should be an interesting few days of training.
5 am. so sleepy. heat index is supposed to hit 119 in places today. sweet.

Had a dream I was king, woke up, still king. 

heat index 110.
soaked after 13 minutes. so hot.

18x1min on : 1min off fartlek. had to go early cuz today is supposed to be over 100 degrees again. was going to do this tomorrow when it's cooler (was 85 when I started this run), but I kinda wanted two down days before this race. averaged 6:07 pace for the workout portion of this run (5.75 miles in 35:13) which is a little faster than I thought I was going. The heat made me feel like I was going a lot slower I guess... still felt pretty sluggish.

Went down into the bayou out and back. I swear half this run is in Louisiana. I thought there actually my be a croc waiting to jump out at me from the tall grass. Feels just like the deep south - all the signs are shot up, there are swamps on both sides, lynchin' trees... unreal. really cool place to run though.
just a shakeout/token run. strides after
planned on being super sore and going really slow today. Turned out I felt superb. However much sense that makes...
figured I should start being serious about recovering a bit, so I stayed slow. Felt good.
terrible. shins hurt, I ate too close to this run (and too much). sloshy, heartburn, felt sick... ugh.
felt good. little rough at first, better as it went.
this run felt like it took 3 hours. my shins and knees were killing me. ice bath after, I'll keep an eye on it.

I wasn't going to run tonight on account of my legs feeling so awful this morning, but I got home and Val wanted to run, and I've never run with her so I figured what the heck. she was only going like 3 and running 9 minute pace isn't exactly killer. we only ended up going two cuz it was so humid. on the way back we did some fartleks just for giggles. she actually has some decent top end speed and her form is good when she's sprinting. we sprinted for 100m and I actually had to reach a bit to pull away from her. def. sub 5 pace. impressive for never training. Anyway, I'll count this run since I was technically running, but I'll run at least 102 this week then to get over 100 legitimately.

6x5 minute easy tempo around 5:45 pace. 2 minutes jogging recovery.

This run was cool for two reasons. First I happened to run into Matt Volz from the U of M and he's in Hastings all summer working on the bridge so we talked a little and we're going to run together tomorrow, and whenever else it works out. Baller. Also, I was running by Louis Lane and Southview and this girl was sitting next to her pool and as I passed she started making legit loud orgasm noises. Guess there's a first for everything. I need to get new shoes cuz I should probably hit up a 20 this weekend and I don't much want to do it in the shoes I have.
awesome night run on the soft trails out at spring lake park.

maybe more, but I'll be fair. Ran with Matt Volz, nice to have someone to run with. overall a pretty good run, just felt kinda winded the whole time. like you just sprinted up the stairs and then are trying to talk to someone. good day, good night.
Just really sleepy, tired. Hot and humid out.

was going for 20 today, but had to balance the cost/benefits of continuing. I'm not one to cut runs short, but today it was for my own safety that I did. 80-84 degrees, 90% humidity. took powerade and GU at miles 5 and 12 - felt strong through 15, but right after that I went downhill fast. survival shuffled my way back as directly as possible. Zero shade on this run. None whatsoever. the only breeze what what I created. I was getting chills and goosebumps by 18, and knowing that it was badically a sauna, that (and the fact that my shoes were completely waterlogged) was enough for me to say the extra 1.5 miles wouldnt be worth the risk. when I finally stopped I had just a wave of heat rush over me and I felt like I was trapped by it. Had to sit in my car in the A/C for a while before I thought it'd be safe to drive. drank a half gallon of powerade and still was 12 pounds lighter at the end of the run than when I started.
highlandpark with leaf and marbar. interesting conversations, john made me run up a ski hill.
evening shakeout. last 3/4 mile around 5:15
this is how all runs should feel. nice run, nice day.
meh.

probably should have bagged this workout before I even started it. Some days feel great, some days feel just awful, and I dont know what causes the difference.

2x(10min tempo, 5 minutes of :30 on, :30 off)

hardly moving by the end of the second 10 minutes.
And sometimes running feels good.

2 loops out at SLP. shaded, nice in that regard. I really had no drive today mentally. I stopped and explored a few times. My body was fine but my head just wasn't in it today. my thoughts of the past 12 hours have resulted in relative apathy toward existing.

on a good note, I found the sweetest cliff in the area. It's a rock outcropping, maybe 70-100 feet above the river. would be an amazing place to sit and have a beer, or jump off of and end it all. depending on your mood.
My soul hurts. I don't feel like running.
Ran with Thornton in san pedro. pretty weak week, but that's alright for now. Felt really good today.
out to spring lake park, one big loop, and back. felt a little worn down.
So much Chinese food. So much heartburn.

just went for a jog today. no effort, at all. wanted to take a morning and just enjoy the beautiful weather for the first time this summer. 60's, nice cool breeze, low humidity, sunshine... took gravel back roads home - locked the cruise at 20 mph, leaned my chair back and threw my legs out the window. beautiful day.

A little over 10, as we were running around 6:10 for the middle chunk with the GPS guys. Ran with the Run n Fun group. Fun stuff, definitely a little odd to be around so many guys who are so much better than I am right now.

with kyle from his place in burnsville. planned on 11, but we ran to eagan, then apple valley, then almost made it to rosemount before he admitted he didn't know where we were. found our way back, but it really sucked.

2 mile warm up 2 mile cooldown.

4x (4x200m with 200m jog after each) 2minutes between sets.

the goal was 34's, 33's, 32's, 31's, but my gauge on pace and effort is non-existent right now. and I have no speed.

33.7, 35.1, 32.8, 34.1

32.0, 33.2, 33.3, 33.1,

31.7, 32.3, 32.1, 32.4,

30.8, 31.8, 32.0, 31.0

You know it's bad when you're running a 31 and literally tying up the last 30m trying to hold on.
2 mile warm up, 8x100m hill sprints, 2 mile cooldown. did them on the path leading up to nininger from the dike. felt really strong.
all cuz my first mile was like... 8 minutes. sore, but a good sore.

well, this was a shock to the system. road 5k, pace was all over the place. thought i could progression run it and hit a goo time and stay comfortable, but apparently doing no speedwork for 3 months don't lend itself to fast 5k's. ran 16:05, with splits of, wait for it, 5:35, 4:51, 5:05. and the 4:51 had a hill in it. Went out with Adam braun and another kid, and we were 70m clear of the field by 1000m. our first 300m was like.. sprinting. bad idea, it sent my cardio into shock and it was a death march from there.

we hit the mile, and it was like we panicked. braun has run 9:19, 4:19, and 15:24 so I knew he was good for the pace, and I thought I was but... wow. I really didn't even consider not breaking 16..

and insult to injury, my nipples chaffed.

started out nice and easy with brooke and my mom was biking. ran 7:30-7:45 pace for the first 3 or 4, then gradually started to pick it up. brooke turned off from me at 5.5, and my mom stayed on for about 12. so I only had to solo 10 of the miles. the first 10 miles was 71:25 or so, then the next 10 was about 65 and change, so I picked it up, but my effort never really increased. felt good, felt strong. other than my feet hurting a little bit at times from 17-20, no problems. had powerade @ 10, and water+GU at 16. no problems.
minneapolis with marb and JL. good run.
just a kenyan shuffle. felt really nice.

3 mile warm up, 3x(400-600-800) w/200m jogging recovery. 2x400 after with 300m jog.

finish with 4x150m hill bursts.

felt like my legs were just slogging. haven't gotten back my snappyness yet. figured I'd start at 16:00 5k pace because that's all I was sure I could do.

74, 1:56, 2:35

74, 1:52, 2:31

69, 1:48, 2:28

65, 67

all that was in my stomach was beer, ibuprofen, and coffee. burn, pain, ouch. hangovers suck. this run was bad. then I went to old country buffet and made sure my misery lasted the rest of the day. all on trails at lebanon hills.
spring lake park at sunrise.
mark conned me into this when he woke up. I got in my double in before lunchtime today. I always said I could theoretically triple with the job I have. Guess I proved it today.
easy run. so far so good on the new training plan. we'll see if I survive tomorrow. I think that'll be a better indicator.

good good good day. Ran with Leaf from his place. first 3 were around 7:40 pace. just shuffling. next 3 were 7's, then the final 14.75 averaged 5:58's. felt really strong and really smooth from wire to wire. conversational the whole time. really helped to have JL there to keep the pace in check. didn't take off until about 3 or 4 to go, which was in retrospect kinda dumb cuz then I got lost, and probably wasn't moving much faster. But I wanted to empty the tank, and needed to do what I did to do it. 4xstrides after felt weirder than that time that I... nevermind. Ragnar and the duathalon were both going on so we even had some legit fan support, cowbells included. cheers to having the triangle contentedly ratchet-strapped down, if only in my mind, and if only for a day.

fun stuff.
easy run with kuhn and andi since they were both in town.
ran with Dan Allen up in St Paul. slightly faster and slightly longer than I was planning on. Tomorrow shall be 7 miles of Kenya shuffle.
shuffle shuffle shuffle.

15x1:1 fartleks.

first 30 seconds around 10k pace, last 30 seconds opening up the stride and floating a bit like the last 400 of a race. felt pretty darn snappy.
pretty conservative for most of this run cuz running after dark on uneven sidewalks terrifies me. opened up near the end, felt great.
felt fine. done for the day!
supposed to do a 10/6 double with strides, but I decided to alter it mid-run. 8, shakeout with strides tonight, easy and short tomorrow. started slow and sore, felt strong by the end.
3 mile shake out + 3 buildups + 7 strides. Frosty.
challenge/busfarm/nicollet. felt fine.

ran for 2 minutes, stopped and walked home. My heart isn't in it right now. I hope it's just a phase... I'll grind through this week and see if it comes back, but right now I just couldn't care less about running.
14 mile progression. first 4 miles were just a jog, next 5 @ 28:28, last 5 @ 26:49 (net uphill) good workout, still don't care.
In winona. Still drunk. What a night...
night run. felt fine.

2 warmup, supposed to do 5xmile @4:50.

ran 4:59, 5:01, then dropped out at 1200 of the 3rd one. 90 or so degrees, humid, and the wind... the wind was what I just couldn't keep fighting. jogged, went home. angry.
tried to make up for this morning. 2 mile warm up, 3 mile progression at 6:00, 5:20, 4:55. much better than this morning.
night run after 11 hours of work. gross.

a terrible week of training. i got this in in the middle of a long day of goose hunting, after eating soooo much McDonalds. also, I've been awake for over 2 days now with maybe... and hour of sleep. My lifestyle has become destructive. pretty concerned about the 10k this monday.
in St Peter with mark and joe. I think i'm sick. legs felt fine.

Legs felt amazing and springy and quick. However my guts had different ideas for my run, and I had to keep stopping cuz I felt sick. Also, I despise running in the dark cuz I'm so paranoid that I'm going to trip and fall or roll my ankle. So either I need to find somewhere else, somewhere better lit to run, or come to terms with night runs being ungodly slow.
felt so good. beautiful, beautiful, beautiful day.
felt SO smooth, and incredibly strong. good things. I don't know how/why I feel so good after hard efforts, and crappy after easy runs, but hey, I'll take it.
Felt pretty awful today. karma?
shake out and strides

3x5k @ Half marathon pace. Didn't know where the loop was, but made one up that ended up being EXACTLY 3.10 miles. 

16:33
16:18
16:04

got a little quick, but felt good. 3 minutes of jogging and some strides between. Mostly flat, few rolling hills. good day.
easy jog.
supposed to go super easy today. So I did.
out and back on the summit ave parkway with JL, trud, and the gnome. little sluggish on the way out, fine on the way back.
easy run along river road with JL. did 3 build ups after mile 4, and then walked to last quarter mile so as to not go over 6. felt fine.

at the lakes. first 5 mile easy with leaf, then on my own for the last... 16.87. Mapped and re-mapped, still got the same distance. didn't think I was going sub 6's but averaged 5:43.9 per mile for the last 16.87 miles. only did 2 strides after cuz I was chafing pretty bad. oddly enough, this didn't feel like a long run, but on paper I guess it seems pretty daunting. start on calhoun, run down to harriet, lap around harriet, back to calhoun and finish the lap around that, lap around isles, another lap around calhoun, another lap around harriet, one more lap around calhoun, then back to the harriet band stand and flipped back to calhoun parkway and 36. time to relax :)
workout for today was 1 hour at the easiest, slowest jog I could imagine. and, well, here it was. hamstrings were a bit stiff.

most beautiful day I can remember.  54 degrees, first dry crunchy leaves on the trail... I felt so excited to be out running, I could have just gone on forever. Ialso feel like I'm the fittest I've ever been in my life. good day today.

wouldn't even count this were it not for what happened during the run. I was supposed to go 7 but I ended up running past my cousins house, stopping in, eating some pickled beans and mike-n-ike's and just running back. On my way back I was passing by target and I hear laughter. This guy and his girlfriend, presumably, were walking toward the trail I was on. he was laughing. she says, stop it you couldn't run that fast (I was only going like... barely sub 7's) he goes, I could totally run faster than him. I thought nothing of it till i heard footsteps behind me and sure enough, there he was running up behind me. So I drop to like... 30 second 200m pace and blow him out of the water and from his dying bewildered self I just hear, 'What the fuck!?' soooo gratifying.
11 easy, then 8x400m hills, all between 73 and 76
feeling good, knee a bit tight.
F. had to cut the run, IT band or upper outside of my calf was really hurting.
knee was still an issue, but as long as I kept it slow, it was manageable.
nothing like working till 10 and then running...
easy sleazy 6 around Northfield. full of laughs and good hashing.

garbage run, just a throw away workout. I did today what I was supposed to do mid-week, but skipped due to my knee. 12x1-1 fartleks, 3 miles easy, 20 minute tempo. Well in spite of having made this mistake with similar results in the past, at about 2:30 I ate a bunch of BBQ ribs, cake, a sandwich, and some crackers with hummus. I slept for like 2 hours and then did this. I felt so sick... Not the usually heartburn, just... bloated and my stomach felt hard. Maybe it was a good thing because it forced me to take it a bit easy, and with my knee not being 100%, that may have helped. the minutes on were probably 10k pace, the 20 minute tempo averaged like... 5:36's. I stopped feeling awful with 45 seconds left in the 20 minute tempo. figures. Knee held up though. tomorrow morning we'll find out for sure.

wore flats to hopefully alleviate some of this IT band stuff, kept my stride short also. felt about 90%. beautiful day though. just warm enough to sweat through a t-shirt and contemplate taking it off. interesting sight: you know how cars test their agility by weaving in and out of road cones (to the left of one, the right the next, left of the following, etc.) I saw a sparrow doing the same 'every other' weave as it flew in line with a chain-link fence, bobbing and weaving between the links. impressive.

barefoot on the soccer fields. ran pretty slow cuz it was completely dark out and i knew there were metal benches out on the fields and I only knew generally where they were. I didn't want to run into one and end my season. knee wasn't really an issue at all.
leg only was an issue for the first 3 or 4 miles. I'll try to finish it off today.
part one of Hell day is done. Today is theoretically the 'hardest day' of my training cycle. this morning mile warm up, 3 miles at MP (5:49's), 6 miles @ HM (5:19's) cool down. EASY.

session 2 of hell day complete. 

1.25 mile warmup
3 miles @ 5:30 pace (goal 5:50)

3x(800,1000,1600) @ HM goal pace (2:40, 3:20, 5:20)
200m recovery jog between everything

(2:38, 3:18, 5:18)
(2:40, 3:16, 5:18)
(2:39, 3:22, 5:19)

felt really springy and fresh at the start, which is why I rolled 20 seconds per mile faster than planned. whatever, I'll go with it. then I got on the track for the paced intervals. easy first set, little discouraging on the second set, and by the start of the last set I was just straight up tired. still ran fine, but I don't think I could have gone any faster, really. maybe 76's tops. the last 400m of my last 1600m interval I felt just like I did at the end of lumberjack days 10 mile. I was starting to get a bit delirious, my guts had gone to liquid and I felt somewhat sick. did two miles of barefoot, laughably slow cool down on the soccer fields and went home to the coldest 20 minute ice bath I've ever taken. 

Also, the girls high school flag football team was practicing on the infield of the track. got some interesting comments, a bunch of stares, some flirtatious giggles, but I was in no mood to be chummy and flirty. sorry girls, I'll go to jail another time, thank you.

so much sore. so much kenya shuffle.

I actually felt like I'd been hit by a truck and was trying to run to safety or something. legs demolished. Never really loosened up either. I woke up at 3:22 am and couldn't fall back to sleep because my legs hurt so much... that was new. Also, my stomach was eating itself, so I had 3 peanut butter and jelly sandwiches and tried going back to bed.

6.25 easy, then supposed to do 20x200, but after the second one it was SUUUUPER apparent that my body hadn't recovered enough from wednesday to do it, so i hung it up and ran 3 more miles barefoot slow. good day.

the patented Nick Ross/Mark Bartley 4:50 am caffeine pill alarm clock. It was ball sack cold this morning, but I had to get it in sometime cuz the rest of today was pretty well shot. 39 degrees, and I did not want to lose any of my bed-warmth, so I wore tights, a winter hat, gloves, a short sleeve and long sleeve top... Was pitch black when I started, and black when I finished. Stars were pretty, felt decent for it being this early. Just ran around for 37:30, figuring I couldn't be going slower than 730's.

18.38 miles averaging 6:42's, then about a quarter mile jog to the backside of featherstone hill (by where the road becomes gravel) then 8x175m hills with jogging down for recovery. 35, 34, 34, 34, 34, 34, 34, 31.

felt good for the most part.
easy. short. easy. breaking in the new flats.
weird tightness in some new places. not concerned though.

3 mile warm up
4x2k @ HM, 10k, 10k, HM
2 mile cool down
6x hill strides

6:41, 6:23, 6:22, 6:40

felt ok. rainy, sorta windy. would have like the  middle two to feel a touch easier.
my patella hurt a little. weird.
easy breezy jog.
shake out, strides. feel great.

this is how i felt today:

morning shake out just to wake up and loosen up a bit.
well, this is what happens when you run in the cities and *think* you know where you're going. Actually a quite enjoyable run. perfect weather

not sure what the time for this run was cuz my watch died. anyway, after taking 2 days off to try to curb the plantar fasciitis, it was still there. dull as opposed to sharp, which is good, but still there. I ran really high up on my toes today, and that seemed to minimize the pain so much so that I hardly felt it, but when that shit is on your mind you feel it even if it isn't there. threw a heel lift (aka a balled up sock) in an old pair of trainers for walking around in, and then i didn't feel it at all, so I'll wear that all day. if anyone has suggestions - i'm eating pills like candy, massaging, stretching the calves, etc... let me know. gotta hang on 18 more days then i don't care wtf happens. if i have to get cortisone, then I'll get cortisone.
well call me john leaf cuz it's less that 3 weeks out and my foot hurt like his hammy tonight.

not a bad run. foot got better as i went, and at mile... wish I didn't feel it at all. good sign? maybe. weird thing was that it didn't hurt if i pretty seriously heel struck, but if i was mid foot or on the balls of my feet it hurt. I have an appointment with the podiatrist tomorrow, we'll see what happens. I was ITCHING to run fast today, but it hurt when I opened my stride up.

alright alright. better than yesterday day. 10 minutes into this run my foot was relatively loose and I did 10x 1-1 fartleks. not very fast, but it was something, and i handled it pretty well. perhaps I may make it to the starting line after all. Goal: be able to do a workout this weekend and get back on schedule starting monday.

first 2 miles: 13:38
last 2: 12:22. 

had to book it cuz i was on a gravel road, pitch black out, and a car was coming that i had to beat to the corner or stand a decent chance at being hit by. That being said, foot was almost entirely pain free. I've been stretching, strengthening, massaging, icing, heating, sleeping in a splint, walking with a heel lift, putting stuff on it topically, taking diclofenac, using DMSO, had the podiatrist tape it.... you name it, I'm doing it. I'm going to beat this thing.

HUGE shout out to Dustin Franta for the massage/stretch/warm up prior to getting out of bed tip. WORLD of difference.

pretty good day today. was slated for some 1k repeats but as good as the foot did feel, i know it's not 100% so i stayed away from the track. did 3x3mins, 2x2mins, 5x1min all at about 5:05 pace, 2 minutes recovery. felt nice to just... move again.
little more sore today than it has been.
everything about my body feels so good and so strong and so fit right now, but my foot is really killing my dreams. tonight wash;t so bad, but there's def. room for improvement...

2x10k with 1 mile jog between.

1st @ MP
2nd @HM

didn't know what to expect with my foot being so touch and go, but it felt pretty decent this morning, so I thought I'd have a go at the workout. the pain never really escalated above a dull ache, so that's good. we'll see how it feels tonight/tomorrow morning. 

36:04
32:38

the first 10k was the easiest, most boring experience I've had in a long time. I was entirely able to chat, look around, pretend I was a bird... I dunno. 5:49's are cake. could have run that pace for a looooooooooooong time.

the seconds 10k was not as fun. I was never out of control, or completely dead, but keeping that pace required some work, and a lot of concentration. started out @5:18's, picked it up a bit with 2 miles to go, closed in a 5:07.

If my foot holds out I feel strong and ready for this half. Inside of 2 weeks... lets do it.
1 hr easy. kinda sore, foot kinda hurt.
7:10's out, 6:50's back. felt 80%
pretty much pain free.

3 mile warm up, 10x 1:1, felt kinda fat and slow, but I'm pretty sure they were all at least sub 5 pace...

about a 7 mile cool down.
easy, felt good. a little cool out and my calf hurt a little bit, but overall a good run. still kinda feel fat.

I realize this run didn't 'do' anything for me, but it was 10pm and I'm going stir crazy. I don't know if it's just cuz this race is finally coming up or what, I mean, i'm at about 88 miles for the past 7 days so I shouldn't be taper-anxious right now... I just needed a sanity run. Cold out, full moon. If this is how I feel now, next week is going to be a treat. Felt really strong.

good good run. felt easy and effortless and light. ran the first 7 miles faster, slowed for 1 mile at the end. 6 strides after and there was no limit to how fast my legs would turn over. the last stride i actually ran right out of my shoes. I had my trainers on which are never tied super tight and at top speed on the final one my right shoe came off. today was a good day.

2 up, 2 down, 2x2mile at HM with 1 mile recovery.

well, I measured out a route to do this on that's fairly flat, but didn't think about the 20+ mph wind. turns out my first 1/3 of a mile was straight into it, then it was at my side, and I only had it behind me for the last quarter mile. When I'm fighting wind, I have NO IDEA what kind of pace I'm running, because I can't gauge my effort. wanted to run 5:20 pace and feel relaxed, well, i opened the first half mile in 2:30 - into the wind mind you - and felt gassed the rest of the way. second one, opened in 2:35, still felt gassed.

oh well, yesterday felt amazing, and I still hit the times today, even if it was closer to 10k effort.

10:31, 10:35

first 7 miles right on 7 minute pace, last 5 miles: 28:07

body felt good, my left calf kept tightening up, but the fact that I was pretty dehydrated may have had something to do with it. never was pushing, just... moving quicker. 22-30 mph winds made this not too much fun though.

and this was after cooling the jets the last mile. left calf got tight again, I'll ice it. 

taper taper taper
fresh fresh fresh

2 w/u

6x800 w 200m recovery, 

fast, HM, HM, HM, HM, fast

ran this workout at 7:30 am to kinda get a feel for cold, early morning fast running. I don't know if it was the wind, or the speed or the 40 degree temps but I was felt really winded during the first and last (fast ones). legs felt great, just couldn't get enough air. the middle ones were jokes, of course.

2:20, 2:41, 2:41, 2:38, 2:41, 2:21
first mile was 7:43, last mile was 6:37, and the effort was the same. cold out again. ice bath after

Well, I definitely feel strange. My body feels weird, foreign, kinda fat, like I only have one pace... but I haven't gained any weight, my legs feel fresh - minus my few aches and pains - and I'm sure it's all in my head. Delaubs hasn't steered me wrong yet so I'm trusting his plan, as much as it's driving me crazy to not double at all. foot was fine today, left calf was 80% - a little nervous about that yet, but hopefully it clears up soon. Hope it's not too cold on saturday morning, I'm not really sure how to dress.

a few light strides after.

Well, time to see what I can do.

just an easy jog, at whatever pace felt good at the time. started pretty slow. right calf was a bit sore, and I could tell I had raced somewhat, but overall I actually felt pretty remarkable today. No concerns.
felt reeeeeealllllly good.

2 warm up, 6x400, 4x200 with 200 jog between, continuous run. looking for sub 70's, and 90% effort for the 200's.

69, 68, 68, 68, 68, 71

32, 32, 32, 31

was gonna wear spikes, but I still had the 3/8 inch inserts in from eau claire. bummer. Felt fine. good to get a little turnover in. Hope to run tonight, but my coworker is sick and went home so I'm stuck here till 10, and I have to be in plymouth tomorrow at 9, then work 11 hours, so I have to get up to run by 5am at the latest. the next 24 hours of life are gonna suuuuuuuuuuck.

4:45 am. started in the dark, finished in the dark.
38 degrees, windchill of 32.
before an 11 hour workday.

oh yeah, and the last 4 miles? it sleeted on me. one of those days the world just gives you the finger.

darkest night I've run in... probably ever. No moon, clear sky. I could tell my clothes from the air around them. That being said, let me recount the hours leading up to this run. 'what's that? mushroom swiss burgers? I'll have two! You made fries? you want... Are you.. should I eat that whole plate of them? are you certain? ok, if you insist. ohhhhh and veggies? I guess I should probably to balance out what I just did.. A halloween cake? you shouldn't have. Sure I'll have a piece. that was good. one more. and... maybe just the frosting off of another. and that bowl of candy? a halloween staff party just wouldn't be the same without candy. I better have one of each.'

Needless to say, this run sucked. Or as Greeno would probably say, 'that run was just straight up S'ed. Couldn't believe it. Thought I was gonna P my G's out the whole T!'

Strides after.
running.
ran up in los ciudades con kurt-pablo and JL. a good run. same hash we always have. felt good. i guess a 50 mile week will do that.

felt good, felt easy. Trying to figure out what to do for training/racing. Do I just jog around to get through thanksgiving and then take some time off and start gearing up for track? or do I train seriously for another month and run at XC nationals out in Seattle with the RNF guys, pushing track training back a ways.... oh the dilemmas.
how many times will i have to eat a big dinner and suffer through a run before I learn my lesson?

long warmup, 30 minutes of minute on:minute off, with the on minutes right around 4:30 pace, give or take a little. cool down.

felt ok, some weird spasming in my left glute/hip, but wasn't a problem after the first rep or so.

ran for about a half mile and my hip/butt was pretty painful. I think it's possibly sciatic. the pain originates just distal to my left Illiac crest, and runs laterally below it. also, if in a lunge position, there is a nerve-pain-like flaring along my sacrum. Taking today to just rest it, massage, ice, heat etc.
just a really easy hour. my hip still is bugging me. I'll try to work on it some more today.
everything felt easy easy except for having to stop and stretch twice cuz even after taking the weekend off and a raging 30 mile week last week, my hip still killed. Chiropractor tomorrow.

Welp. I don't know what to do anymore. state xc championships are saturday so that's out, nationals is a month from tomorrow, and i can't run two miles.

sweet. I have no idea what to do but I haven't felt this depressed in a long time. I was in such good shape and now it's just going away.

F.
75 minutes on the bike. Time to get serious about doing something. I'm not used to being hurt...
60 minutes on the bike. fun fun fun for all!

75 minutes hard on the bike. the calorie counter only goes up to 1000.

ran 200m today and felt good.

8 minute pace for 3 miles? I'm such a baller. and it hurt.

I don't know what;s up with my hip still, but I don't like it.
45 minutes on the bike.
made it, but it wasn't pretty. gotta try.

felt super easy, much better than yesterday. everything felt good minus the phantom piece of shrapnel that seems to be stuck in my hip. just get me through December 10th. limping, crawling, I don't care. I'd like to actually start training again sometime...
Ran around st. pete with the kuhntang.
bridges in the new wonderful snow/ice with Joe and Token. Wanted 10, but the hip was not having it. I miss running with those guys. I wouldn't want them to get kicked off the team though.

on the treadmill cuz I didn't know how my hip would do, and i wanted to do something quick, cuz if my hip can't take it I'd rather know now than during the race on thanksgiving. and there is ice on the roads, and it was dark. 

2 mile warm up, 2x1mile @ 5:15 pace, 2x half mile in 2:25

felt easy, but like i couldn't quite get enough air, but that was probably cuz I was congested. Surprised at how easy it still felt. I hope i can make the race on thanksgiving tactical, and win with like 28 flat.... ha.
zero percent of this run was fun. ouch.
By far the most ill prepared I've ever been for a race. say a prayer r2w world!
treadmill trot. music on, brain off, felt reasonably good. We'll see how tomorrow goes. one day at a time.

Ran with Kelly, first hour easy, then 15ish minutes at tempo pace. felt relatively good, though my legs felt trashed after. I guess this is what coming back feels like. Hopefully it's behind me now though.

2 mile warm up, progressive tempos.

15 minutes @ 5:42's
10 minutes @ 5:18's
5 minutes @ 4:50's

1.5 mile cool down. 3ish minutes of jogging between.

Felt reasonable, definitely can tell that I'm not where I was in october, but I think I can get it back. It also didn't help that I had a whole plate of Lebanese chicken yakhni, tabouli and pumpkin pie in my stomach. Damn you JJ.
recovery run, but I still felt like crap.
felt pretty good. just flowed with it, last 3 miles were like 19:19. Nothing like the last day of november and wearing short sleeves and shorts.
Around burnsville with Dono. Not a bad run, and the roads were only 20% sucky. Got into the closest thing to an altercation since college. Good times. Hip held up perfectly until about 8.
out and back to the bayou corner. 26:37 out, 25:28 back. felt good.
didn't want to do a 5 mile run, so I made it into a 'workout' just to break it up in my head. 2 miles easy, 1 mile @ about 85% - 4:48, 2 miles easy.

Nice run. Aside from my hip being pretty rough, my body felt great. Ran the trails through the SLP area along the river. At mile 2 it began to snow, and running through the cedars  while it was snowing was gorgeous. Was probably going close to 6:30's until mile 6, when everything had a layer of snow over it. I slowed down a lot then since slipping and breaking something wasn't on the schedule for today. Listened to music while I ran today, which was different. Really chill songs, alone in the woods and snow = beautiful run.

Days like today almost make me believe that winter running in MN is alright. But I know better.

most of this run was through 5-6 inches of untouched snow, but most of this run was flat. along the river in burnsville, past the power plant where I was able to get in my last 7 years worth of toxic, noxious heavy metals and other radioactive elements. good day.
felt awesome, just wanted to get 80. I'm coming back, but don't call it a comeback.
felt like i was going much much quicker than this, but I guess running on ice/snow will do that.
my left tonsil is swollen to the size of a marble, and when anything (including saliva) touches it, it's excruciating. no other symptoms anywhere. odd.
So sick. So so sick.

Well, I'm on azithromycin, percocet, and prednisone.

Let's all imagine how confused I was during this run.
On the course in seattle. this should be a blast... 5 2k loops. wooo....
pretty slick out there.. felt good though.
hip still is a bit of an issue. but its mid 30's or low 40's in december.... no complaints. I just wish I could start doing some actual running.
felt good as long as I kept my stride loose and my foot strike forward. the uphills sucked. Probably going to just take the week to get some strength back and worry about 'mileage' later

thought I'd try it again today. good till about 5. I'll try to massage it a bit today and see how tomorrow feels. Ran with leaf and kuhntang. I can't imagine how many millions of times I'll be running this loop...
summit parkway. even after the time off the hip is still there. it didn't 'hurt' per say, but it was definitely there.

Ran the Franklin Lake standard. Hip felt alright, and the rest of me felt good. I really would like to get back to actually training one of these days, but I won't jump into that until this darn hip is 100%. Beautiful morning, ran in half tights. The last mile of this run does seem to take forever though.

Ford bridge loop. hip was reasonable. Had some awesome thoughts that now escape me. Was going to run again tonight really short, but the ended up staying at work till 10. sweeeeeeeeet stuff. I need some beer battered pickles.

same route as yesterday, just in reverse. Unconsciously alternated between easy, relaxed jogging and standard 6:30ish cruising. This was the first run that I didn't have to stop and stretch my hip on, which I'll take as a good sign. It was tightening up in the last half mile or so when I had to stop at intersections.

run in the snow with JL. a bit slippery, and things were getting tight back on Marshall, but otherwise the run was good. Only a general idea of where we were most of the time, but it was ok. I feel like i can get back to the 10 mile range now. If all goes well, real training begins Jan. 2nd. mark my words.
lets hear it for being lazy. squeaked this in between Ross' and Magees'. Just to say I ran.

first actual, pain free run in a long time. I was so excited to be out there and not have anything hurt. Going to use this as my mileage prep week, and then hopefully actually start real training on monday. Incredible weather too. December 27th and I could have easily gotten away with shorts. I wore a long sleeve t-shirt and was really hot and sweaty by the end. Unbelievable. Fantastic day.
easy double. felt great.
just lollygagging around on the lilydale route with bartley. Ran from run n fun, shorts, long sleeve on Dec. 28. love it.

Welp, the plan was somewhere in the 9-12 range, and I didn't get out this morning cuz of stupid meetings, but by 1.5 I had a side-ache that forced me to get really friendly with joy-jogging pace, and ultimately cut it short. Everything felt good though. We're still on for real training starting monday!
solo out and back on summit before meeting up with leaf, foley, prieve and small kate. then we ran 7. felt good, great weather, good day.
really hard to get myself out the door for this one. Saw some people having a bonfire on summit roasting marshmallows. it's december 30th. nuts.
Franklin lake with leaf, little kate, prieve, and foley.

it was like running on an uneven skating rink. Last night's ice storms made the roads pretty much un-runnable. ran with delays, leaf, and little kate and after 4 we just couldn't take it. there was no traction anywhere, and I didn't have my student ID so there was no treadmill option.
ice run with leaf, delaubs, and sorenson. That ice is really busting my balls... Hopefully a few days in the 30's/40's will take care of it. The body feels good, Im ready for some mileage.

from run n fun with the team. was fairly moving by the end - roads were pretty awful in places yet, a few guys fell. The real story was the juicy supreme challenge at shamrocks afterward. Got to see choker throw in the towel with about 5 fries left and puke, and then watch kelly throw up too. Props to choker though from eating his first enormous double burger in two minutes and the first entire basket in 6.
behind my right knee hurts. That is all.
Como Lake 10, solo. It's Jan. 6th and I wore shorts and two t shirts and was soaked with sweat and wet from splashing through snow melt-off. This is heavenly.

down to the Crosby Farm trails with Phil Richert And Jake Marotz. Pretty sweet to have some company, and some banter to listen to other than my own thoughts. from miles 9-12 I was really starting to get a reality check as to how out of shape I've become, but then the last three with Jake out and back on Summit actually felt pretty smooth. Great weather, good company. No Complaints.
around phalen with Dan Allen. Pretty decent run, just felt a bit out of shape cardiovascularly.
solo Ford Lake Summit. good morning.

Cathedral with Leaf and Kurt. jogging at times, rolling at times. My right quad got a little cramp towards the end, but overall felt fantastic. low 40's, shorts, best conversation I've had in a while. Started with the either/or propositions, then hypotheticals, and eventually moved on to big existential stuff. Good run.

Sorry RnF boys, my quad is a bit too messed up to handle anything sub 7's tonight.

good convo with leaf, ran in the evening, 50 degrees. had to run to the blue door and back to get reservations. quad was ok, still hurt on and off randomly. weird.

ran to summit and my quad wasn't loosening up in the least so I flipped it and came home. If it's better tonight I'll run then. I keep getting right to the edge of full health and ability to train hard again and then something flares up. Gotta stop that cycle somehow.
power plant out and back. probably over 10, I'll just go a little less than 5 tonight.
With Burt and JL. neighborhoods. not bad, but really cold and windy. felt fine. good indicators!

Cathedral, solo. 10 degrees, windchill of zero. Pretty cold starting out, but warmed faily quickly. You know you've become soft when 10 degrees makes you contemplate the treadmill. Darn you you deceiving Minnesota winters. Felt really smooth today. Glutes are a little sore from yesterday, but no complaints! Now If I can just stay healthy and actually string together some reasonable training. I'm not used to this being hurt stuff.
como with the guys. good run, kinda chilly.
one of those runs where life is just good. I felt good, I was just the right temperature, the weather was nice, everything clicked and I just glided right along.
morning amble around summit. not good, not bad. just running.
with the run n fun guys. started really easy, finished around 6 flats.

Just 13 below.... Way over dressed, but I'm glad I did. I hate being cold. Pushed it a little more than most normal morning runs, but I guess I'll be working 12 hours today, so running again today might not happen. Everything felt good though!

meh. went over to the treadmills because it was negative a million out there. damn state. hopped on galloped for a bit, decided to go 6x5minutes on with 2 minutes jogging recovery, but these mills only went down to 5:27 pace. so I did 5, 5, 10, 5, 3, and the last 3 i put the incline at something ridiculous. that felt like I was giving birth to a steer sideways. The rest was easy, I just got bored.
in our little hamster-wheels again with the coconut tree.

hamster wheel again.. Oh, and ski-u too. so much ski-u'ing.

I've been out of the 100 mile weeks for so long I'm starting to wonder if I'll ever be back. I will, I know I will but shiiiit. MN blows monkey nuts in the winter. school, work, and trying to double is just not easy. Though, last year my first 4 weeks of jan were 100's. hell, I ran 100 in singles over christmas break. verdict? I gotta quit being a pussy?
slippery, slushy mess on the east side, decent on the west. good run with kuhn, it went by fast.
Slushy, sloppy, icy, tractionless run. Actually had to shuffle all the way down marshall. Felt good though, given the conditions. first 5 or so with the coconut tree and the chalupa bell grande.

maybe over 10 - the pace was pretty erratic. There were some that were probably close to 8, some under 6. Ran with the RnF guys, but eventually reserved myself to Jake and Phil, since Choker, LaBlanc, Schmick, Justin and Greeno decided to more or less throw down half way through lilydale. Aside from running through snow and over ice, it was a fairly enjoyable run. Good guys, good times.

absolutely terrible footing. Reports are in that the greenway is completely clear though, so that where I'll head tomorrow. 

So guys, spread the word. greenway.

morning spin on the wheel. Above freezing this morning, but my joints and stabilizers needed a break from the slip sliding slush mess that are the trails around here. Sunny, gorgeous day. Probably going to dip out of work pretty early today and get a good run done on the greenway. Not a lot of hamsters at the gym today.
como with Leaf and El rancho fabuloso. good weather, good run. That is all.
At the courthouse all morning wasting my life, at work all afternoon. It would have had to be 4:30am, or after 9 pm, and it just wasn't in me to do that today.

Took the midtown greenway out toward the lakes from the Target parking lot with JL. Flipped it at South James, and took the greenway to west river after dropping off Leaf. Pretty good footing, though the sidewalk on the south side of Marshall was not fun at all. pretty rough getting going, but around mile 6 a switch just flipped and I felt great. Good day, nice weather, good run.

solo run down the greenway to isles. Took a lap around isles and came back home. thought I was keeping the pace really relaxed, but when the trails are slippery and you're running alone it's hard to gauge that. pretty good run, feels good to finally get in a long run for the first time in... months.

The worst run I've had in a long time. My achilles were both extremely tight, and my left foot hurt. There were points where I was actually walking had it not been for the swinging of my arms. The pace ended up being quick cuz the last mile I was so desperate to get back i just dropped the hammer. Form was terrible, the roads were slick, i had side-aches.... I guess I'm not in the shape I used to be in if a 17 miler does this to me now. I did see Natalie Ristau out there, which was odd, but the one positive I can take from this morning. Moving on!

I remember back when I was a real runner. 100's like child's play. Where has the old me gone?
Summit - St. Albans. Felt back to normal minus a little tightness in the achillies still.

Ran with the RnF boys, but it quickly became just me, Reneau, Phil, Nate, James, Dan, and Metz. Good run, things were clicking... I did fall flat on my back in a me-sized puddle in the first 20 seconds, so i was soaked. left achillies was a bit irritated and popping while i walked back to my car though.

way too early, started in the dark. woke up with a nice marble of scar tissue in my left achillies and it was all swollen and puffy, but didn't hurt too much to walk on. did what I could with the time i had and went out towards como 10. made it to Thomas street before knowing I wouldn't be making it, flipped it and shuffled home. hurt like a mofo. I'll do what I can for it today.
the achilles still didn't feel good. franklin lake standard. Every time I get health I hurt something new. This is uncharacteristic of me. Maybe I need to actually do a gradual buildup? Stupid.

Around P town with kuhntang. discussions of life liberty and the pursuit of happiness. did the bird wings down golf cart road. fond memories, good times.

As kuhn explained best, we helped a man in a van find the GAC building at 800 college ave. Help yourself to a science book.
Traverse extended with kuhn, bart, gibbs and the gnome. Haven't laughed that much in a loooooooong time. Conversely, my achilles can go fuck itself.
hurt
hurt

I had half a mind to fill this little box with a bunch of swear words and then toss my computer against the wall. 1 mile. 1 fricken mile? I should be able to make it a mile if someone ran over my legs with a truck. Nothing is working. Nothing is helping. I've iced, heated, massaged, grastoned, done some AR, taken pills, taken time completely off. I know it's only been a week or two - and JL I don't know how you kept it together for months like this, but I just want to stop. Eff this. I feel like i'm drowning in my body and the only thing that attempting to run is doing is causing stress... insult to injury. Is this melodramatic of me? sure. Is it hyperbole to say this feels tragic? maybe. But my spirits have been straight up crushed. you've won this time MN winter. I hate you.

guessing as to the distance. pretty slow. My foot didn't feel good, but it was tolerableish. Pretty positive the pain is originating at my deltoid ligament and radiating upward. not sure what to do from here. I'll just take it a day at a time I guess.
far from a real run, but I got in a few step with JL before having to call it. good for the soul, anyway.

felt good for 11 minutes, rough for 4, then it fairly loosened up. Better than it has been, which is a small blessing at this point. Even if it's 2 miles, and even if it only feels decent for one day, it sure feels good to have something positive under my belt running-wise.
had to stop and walk home. bad. reeeeal bad. mmmmkay?
better than it's been. I have 17 weeks.
the good news is cross training doesn't hurt anymore. the bad news is i ran for 6 minutes and it was excruciating.

My. Sweet. Pussy.

I understand now why normal people don't run every day, and why they would be so shocked when I'd say I run 15+ miles a day. Is this what running feels like to normal folks? So uncoordinated, so many odd pains, so hard to breathe.... And I've been cross training! even doing 2xDays!! I've been doing bike workouts! holy. balls. Good to just get out with Paco today though.

Looking at my calendar on this site makes me feel physically sick. Like... I kind of want to cry.

Fat much?

Pain. Free.

All that matters. Gorgeous day. I don't even care if I'm out of shape, I don't care if I won't be able to run the USA half in June, I'm just happy that I was able to run today. Even if it was just 3 miles.

perfect, beautiful day. 50-60 degrees, not a cloud in the sky. Felt out of shape, but still strong. Like I can be at least back to where I left off soon. for half a block I opened up to about 85% effort and found that I can still fairly clip if I need to.

Finished off with sitting on the edge of my roof, drinking a soda, and watching the day go by. Going to go for a bike ride this afternoon... Excited to get out and moving :)

Pretty much a perfect day.

Daylight savings time for the MF'in WIN. 

another day on the roads, and I am happy.

wouldn't be quite right if I trained smart. this is after morning run and a 20 mile bike with Mom/Alli.

Off to blue door! I've gotten skinny.

slow slow slow survival shuffle. legs a bit tight from yesterday.

Beautiful day.

sunrise run with JL. Achilles felt great, IT was a little sore but not sharp, just felt like I was punched in the leg. Good portion of this run was on grass, which definitely helps.

Another beautiful 65 degree day.
franklin lake standard. really nice weather, a bit sore starting out but loosened up eventually. Left quad/IT is still a little sore, If it's even a thought tomorrow I may take the day off.

beautiful morning run with el pablo ranchero. Cathedral loop, soft ground, felt good.

2 strides after, no concerns.

So, fiesta mexicana and I made a wide loop down to Dan Conway's house to pick up his car that we left there last night. We got there, socialized a bit, and then his car didn't start. What can you do in that situation? so we shuffled the however many miles it was home.

Bad news: I didn't plan on this, and rolling out a 14 mile run (even a slow one) is a bad idea right now

Good news: It didn't hurt.

Then we biked around and watched the human race 8k. Some surprising performances. Well done RnF.
morning galavant down the parkway to test the legs after yesterday's mishap. Things look good.

I was going to name this route 'campus visit' since it runs up into the U, but now I'm going to refer to it as Scholarship Day because this run was SO money.

I felt light, limber, efficient... aerobically I'm not where I want to be yet but I felt really strong.

MOST IMPORTANT PART OF THIS RUN: Ski-fricken-U. Unbelievable. So much 'scenery' out there. By the lake street bridge I saw the most attractive girl I've seen here since moving in December. And she said waved and said hi. Then another girl informed me that 'you could have my babies'

We're going to have fun this year twin cities.

Ate a massive bacon cheeseburger with fried eggs on it before this so I felt like puking and/or dying the entire time. But ran with the team through lillydale. light mist, cool, perfect day.

As much as it's driving me crazy to just sit in my living room and look out the windows, it's for the best that I don't just keep grinding.

left inner shin was a bit tender. but not bad. mostly there cuz I was thinking about it. Ran this mostly on grass, so all should be good. Kept it short so as to not aggravate anything. Followed this run immediately with a fairly hard 27 mile bike ride. Got into a pissing match on the greenway with some (4) guys in matching uniforms. Spent a while reeling them in and went by them. They guy in 2nd said 'who the hell are you?' and I just kept on my way. then I heard one of them yell 'go get that kid!' and sure enough, here comes the peloton up on my left shoulder. I fell in with them (awkwardly) right behind the leader, and with about 3/4 of a mile of greenway left I swung wide, dropped the hammer, and that was that. 

I may not be a biker, but at least I can stick it to bunch of master-blaster weekend warriors.

And I didn't even have clips. Good day.
Late afternoon jaunt with Tijuana Charlie after picking him up from the airport. left shin still having none of it.
just a short loop to test out/try to give the shin a break. raining, windy, cold. ended up picking up the pace on summit cuz it was so miserable. feels maybe... 70%
35 mile bike. to south st paul, over to inver grove, and back home.

I'll supplement this with a bike ride or strength or something tonight.

everything felt so good. 

was going to bike with the guys, but I galloped around the block and nothing hurt, so yeah.

night run around davern meadows with JL and cheese kurt. Felt like the most natural thing on earth the last 2 or so miles. you live for runs like that.

completely jogged at last the first half. not sure how it ended up being this fast. pretty good run though. beautiful day. Had 2 elderly women stop me to ask where planned parenthood was. strange happenings of this world...
felt so good. edgcumbe 9 plus a bit. felt like... dare I say... My old self??
was planning to do a long run, but at mile 6 my shin started to feel less than perfect so I cut it and SLOOOOOOOOW jogged back.

best run of the year. I don't know why, or how it happened, but it was one of those nights where you just glide. Summit St. Albans out and back. out in 17:11, back in 15:54. could just as well have been 7:40 pace as far as effort goes. Haven't felt this strong since last summer. Gonna start looking for some little no pressure race to test the jets.

Ran down to St. Kate's With JL. Most important thing to note is how easy it would be to have grabbed a goose/duck by their arb pond. I'll remember that. Good chat with gangles. kinda sad, but it's life I suppose. Great day.
slow morning jog just to get up and get moving. creepy lady out and back.

Pretty uplifting run with JL, and kurt for part of it. 3x10minutes progressive tempo. First 10 was about 5:45's, next 10 was about 5:30, last 10 was 5:10ish. Didn't expect that kind of pace being my first workout in quite some time. Never had to go to the well either. Was driving a bit the last few minutes of the last rep, but never went to my last gear. stomach was my limiting factor today actually. Good to run fast and feel smooth with the boys.

easy morning recovery trot. Kept it slow the whole time, except for coming through St. Thomas ;)

Felt surprisingly good. Good day (Copyright Phil Richert).
morning shake out/wake up. Not bad. shin a bit sore. The air smelled like crab apples and fresh-cut grass. Awesome.

this was on a lumpy blacktop road, with potholes, in the dark. so many variables could be awry on this workout, but whatever. served it's purpose, good for now.
easy run. started super super slow (7:42 first mile). Felt fine. Race tomorrow to see where I'm at? bring on the 17 flat....
well... this was a 'race'. 5k, won it handily, but boy was I stupid. Sprinted the first 400, then commenced sucking wind for the next 3 miles. ouch. terrible.
2 miles with John and Trud to UST, then J did a workout while Taco sauce and I jogged barefoot on the infield. then back home.

Oregon is EVERYTHING it's cracked up to be. This is heaven. Out and back on the mountain today - about a mile in I had to just stop and stare. The run was mostly on this gravel narrow winding road where one side was the mountain, the other was a cliff, and off the cliff you could see the entire Rogue Valley. Absolutely breathtaking. Ran down the mountain, through the vineyards, then flipped it and came back up. Unreal - we simply do not have hills like this in MN. For the gusties out there, the last half mile of this run was actually worse than Challenge. But I have chills. This place is amazing.

This run was nearly a religious experience. Got up at 7 and had coffee on the coast of Oregon sitting on a piece of drift wood, went back inside, changed, and while I was inside it started POURING. 15 miles, along the coast in the pouring rain. so perfect. I was on cloud 9 and just floating the whole way. At one point I did swing across the road and went up into the hills - redwood trees taller than I can explain, meadows, cottages, tiny, winding, gravel roads.... Everything was green. Almost like I imagine Ireland would be. One of my favorite runs of all time.

easy jaunt around the west side of the mountain. hit some switchbacks, felt like I'd disappeared into the woods. Not a sound, not a soul out there. Even though today was gray and damp, it's so  so so easy to motivate yourself to run. time just flies by. So scenic.

Started at the Southern Oregon University campus in Ashland, then ran to Lithia Park toward the Reeder Resivoir. Unbelieveable. Best kept-up park I've ever seen. Google search that shit. miles and miles of wood chip trails along the creek; everything smelled like fresh cedar. I saw a gate across a dirt road that said no motorized vehicles beyond this point, so I ran up it. Again, straight up a freaking mountain (one of the Siskiyou mountains). Completely by myself, serene... I felt so at peace running through the woods, past waterfalls... not another human for miles. Breathtaking views.... and ashland is like northfield. Young, college town, not a single chain store or restaurant. I could live here. Perhaps I shall. To reinforce how quickly runs go here, I looked at my watch for the first time figuring I was about 3-4 miles in... 52 minutes.

Finished this off with a bacon, egg, and cheese bagel sandwich from cafe 116, and a wonderful cup of coffee. This cafe is on the same plane as colossal. Fantastic, tiny, and a lot of hippies. just sat, ate, and watched the cars drive by.

John: roadtrip destination.

Wanted to do some speed today, but it was my last day in God's country, so I figured I should do something I can't do at home. I rolled west to mud springs and went straight up anderson butte (http://www.placenames.com/us/p1137195/). I have NEVER, EVER, EVER done a climb like that. That mf'er never ONCE flattened out. just straight climbing. When I finally got to the top the road still went up more somehow. Riddle me the physics of that... Bottom line, I'll never complain about hills again, and minnesotans are pussies. I never dreamt my tiddler could be diddled so hard. But it was worth every step of anguish. I love this place. Oregon, you'll be holding my heart. Until we meet again...

Dayton. Back to Minnesota, back to Minnesota problems. Painfree running out west, but this morning my shin (and eventually my glute) reminded me about their displeasure toward running on pavement. Nothing debilitating, but it certainly wasn't fun.
Ford standard. minute on, minute off x10. I feel a long way from being fit.
morning galavant. Probably all I'll have time for today.

*asterisk run* paced the little sister at the earth day half marathon in St. Cloud.

odd feeling, running that slow. I eventually started hurdling things and skipping and dancing and such. At one point I was carrying two drinks and a GU for her, when some guy came up and asked if I had a bagel. I replied, 'yeah, I have a whole continental breakfast under my shirt, actually.' He wasn't amused.

She wanted to break two, she broke two. nice run.
not sure how far this was. Kinda a junk run - no reason really except for something to do. ran over to UST with John and the chupacabra, trotted around while J did his workout, ran home.

Not sure of the actual distance, cuz we ran the trails through the river bottoms by bloomington. Ran with JL and Kurt, and had a dandy time. I would venture a guess that we were quite a bit under 7:08 pace, but I want to be safe with the distance, and the trails can be deceiving. 

Helped a unique fellow take a 'REAL RIVER MONSTER' off of his hook, and proceeded to laugh myself silly at the ridiculous crap he was saying, and his mannerisms. I cannot believe that happened. 'I'm a real bad boy for catching this out of season!!' You bet you are, fucking weirdo. 

He named the northern, 'lucia'. Unfortunately I had no advice for him regarding how he should wash his gloves. Kurt made us run all over creation cuz he navigates like a 16 year old girl, and I happened to educate a man and his two kindergarten-aged sons about sexual escapades when I failed to see them ahead of me. 

Stopped at Lunds on our way back and packed our bodies full of refined sugar, saturated fat, and other excellent foods. Days like this are the reason I run.

100. 

Turns out where I left my car last night was 2 miles away, and I need groceries. So I ran to it. Things felt good, body is holding up.

Kinda cool when your feet are a viable option for transportation.

nice morning trot. felt really good - surprising after the random aches and pains of yesterday.

going to be a gorgeous day.

ballsack. I need to slow down one of these days so I can actually recover, get some pop in my legs, and be able to do a real workout.

But nonetheless, good run. Marshall to scholarship day.

I just wanted to do something that would leave my legs feeling snappy, but still get some volume in, so I did 10x300 with 500 jogging recovery, more or less continuous.

49, 50, 50, 50, 50, 50, 50, 49, 49, 48

I felt like my legs could take anything, I just couldn't keep up aerobically. This is far from a jaw dropping workout, but on the cool down I felt straight crispy - so all is well in the world.

15 mile progression with JL. first 5 around 6:50's, next 5 @ 5:50's, last 5 @ 5:36's. pretty good stuff. achilles was sufficiently loosened up by mile 5, and never really gave me any issues. still a lot of work to be done, but this was  good sign. After 3 hours of sleep and driving down to and back from Val's grad ceremony. So tired. I ran back in time today - then finished with 3 miles or so on the grass, barefoot. Amazing how that changes everything. If I can't start getting on grass in the cities I'm moving.

So here's how this happened:

Mom: Kids, for Mother's Day all I want is for us to take a family bike ride.
Me: Ok, sounds good.

*Reflect on this plan for a moment*

Me: Would it be ok if I just ran with you guys? That way I don't have to run before, and then do it?
Mom: Sure! I think we're just going to go around the Cannon River on the Cannon Valley Trail.

*We drive to the CVT, the run commences*

Me: Well, we're in Welch now (mile 10.5 or so), and there's a drinking fountain at the park. Mind if I grab some water?
Mom: Go ahead.

*Stretching, drinking* 

Me: So... we gonna wrap this up soon or what? How are we getting back from here?
Mom: Um... We're just turning around??
Me: ....... You're..... um.... *bewilderment* You realize this is going to end up being a 21 mile run for me, right?
Mom: Don't you like, do that every day anyway?
Me: Good god. Ok Lets go.

I promptly sat down in the river when we got back, dried off, made her drive me to DQ, and brought $16 worth of ice cream.

Happy Mother's Day.

Remember that one time? that one time when you ran the TC 1 mile? Yeah, things were good for 400... at 800 you felt like you were floating and still rolling fairly well. Then Kelly mortenson went by you like you were standing still... Then that big head wind slapped you in the face.... the 3rd 400 was about 6 miles long, and everything started to unravel? Yeah, times were slow across the board, but everyone ran in them, yes? Do you remember that time when you just gave up? When 49 year old Pat Billig dropped the hammer on you from 300m out and you couldn't respond???

Remember when you ran a 4:52 mile? Well done, Nick.

89 degrees out. shuffled along until I saw Marotz-esque running form ahead of me. Started grinding fairly hard to see if it was indeed him. As running styles never lie, it was. I ran with him for... I dunno. 3 miles maybe? We weren't going that fast but I still felt like I couldn't catch my breath. the heat I suppose. with 2 miles to go I started getting chills and figured that was probably a sign that I should stop a moment, so I got a drink of water and sat in the shade for about 3 minutes. First actual hot run of summer, and I just haven't adapted yet. Liking the new shoes so far

long run with JL back to downtown to pick up our cars. Good gracious this was terrible. 92 degrees, and last night was the most inebriated I've been in a long while. The stories I could tell... Fun times, awful mornings, bad runs.

Wouldn't change it for the world.

Running down Summit with Kurt.... Saw a bunch of kids on the sidewalk just east of hamline apparently shooting of fireworks. Suddenly one firework goes off across the street maybe... 10 yards in front of kurt and I. We stop running, but it looks like on of those little whiz-bang fountain things so we didn't pay much attention. Then it exploded. Mortar shell. I had some flare embers hit my back, but nothing serious. A few more steps and it would have been a problem I'd imagine.

On the way back I reminded everyone we passed (driving and walking) that we are in 'merica! One big pickup with flags in the back shouted 'Yeah! Merica!' back... A group of females didn't seem as amused so i let them know if they didn't like America, then they could giiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiit out!
