gliding.

The script had me down for 3x10minutes today, but i met kate on river road and she had a flat tire so I ran home to get my car, load up her bike, and then just gave her my keys and went about my workout. Since that kinda threw a wrench in things, i ended up doing a 3 mile warm up, 2x1mile at tempo effort, then 2x 10 minutes at tempo effort, all with 3 minutes of jogging recovery - though i kept the jogging fairly honest. the first mile was a 5:20, the second mile was a 5:22, the first 10 minutes was 5:21 pace, and I didn't get a pace on the final 10 minutes, but it wasn't any slower than the first. Pretty happy with this workout, especially considering both 10 minute portions were significantly net uphill (franklin up to the washington bridge, and lower riverside park up the hill beneath franklin bridge). An A for consistency. Felt pretty smooth, snappy. Good evening.

morning recovery stumble.

always good when the morning after a workout doesn't hurt.

lakes with Phil, JL, and kurt. good times.

Early morning track work at UST. One of the most humid mornings this summer. I felt like there was just no oxygen to be found in the air today. Anyway, 10x400 w/60 seconds rest. The goal was to just glide through at straight 72's, no intention of going to the well today at all. Turns out, It's been so long since I've been on a track, I couldn't figure out how to pace these for my life. I finally just stopped looking at my watch and ran by effort.

72, 72, 73, 72, 74, 73, 74, 73, 74, 72

calves were a little tight from yesterday. Lake Hiawatha 13. Pretty quiet out there.

warm up, 12x 2 minutes on 1 minute off, averaging 5:57's for the whole thing (recovery included), the 4 minutes jogging, then 8x100m hill sprints flat out everything I had. 20 minute cool down.

The 'on' portions were somewhere around 5k pace I'd guess. the recovery minute started pretty honest and then tapered off a bit. That damn hill going up to franklin from the river (heading away from washington) is a real strength sucker. Oh well. I'm happy with this one.

a much needed short, slow recovery day.

A really rough run. I knew I'd be stiff from yesterday a little, but my legs were locked until 8 miles. At 5 i threw in a stride or two just to try to loosen up, but I couldn't. Even after 8 miles I could cycle fully, but I was just flat. I had nothing - just one of those death march type runs. 80 degrees, 80% humidity, dew point close to 70. I've had more enjoyable experiences.

What doesn't kill you (usually makes you hate your life?)

first 4 with corn chip kurty, then off on my own around the davern area. On the way back I raced a kid. not slow rolling, a legit race against a 10 year old on a scooter. I came up next to him, and I didn't notice until the dog he was with started to change it's gait - so I looked at him and asked if he wanted to race. He said yes so we flew to St. Claire. We did have to stop at an intersection for a car, and traffic being the great equalizer of racing ability, he caught back up. We 'tied' but I made sure to clearly finish ahead of him for my own pride. We shook hands, said good race, and went our separate ways...

I felt good today. It would make sense that now that I'm getting in shape I'd take care of my body and actually get fast, but it's more immediately pleasurable to go to blue door right after and just jam my body full of the moose cock. That way after thousands of miles I'll run 2:45 this fall, and hate myself. But hey, fuck it. At least I ate a Jiffy and a sack of cajun tots with Rachel, some mexican dude and the elf that sometimes sleeps in John's room. (pants)

Morning. sore. raining a lot. heavy feet. First 3 miles were kinda like power walking but without the power part. Kinda just walking-like.

Oh well. Eff it. 'Merica.

hyper slow run with the guys from run n fun. Ended up running with Kelly and the Mizuno rep. He was having a rough day and Kelly was going by heart rate so was just jogged. I only was scheduled for 4 tonight, so I really don't mind this being somewhat garbage mileage.

What a nut-sucker. I suppose I was due for a bad workout - to this point things have been going surprisingly well. Yesterday's planned 8/4 double that turned into an 8/9.25 double probably set me up to flop this one.

15 mile progression. Ended up hitting 35:56, 29:05, 28:54 for my 5 mile splits. That may be the slowest miles 10-15 I've ever run for a progression. I was already starting to go flat around mile 7, and then by mile 12 I'd bonked HARD and was struggling to just stay on my feet and moving in the right di-erection. I suppose yesterday, the hills, the relentless humidity, and the fact that it was 6 fricken 30 in the morning probably all tossed their little bit of miserable together to make this a workout I'm eager to forget about. Also, and this could just be sand accumulation in my female parts, but I felt like once my shoes were soaked, I was losing a ton of momentum at each toe off from my feet slipping around inside of my shoes.
stiff legged evening shakeout so that I stand a slightly better chance of not feeling like phallus tomorrow.

pretty sore morning today. Lots of odd, but sharp pains - mostly in my right quad/right hip. Don't really know how to stretch it or massage it because it's so deep. Oh well. Around the U today.... Remember that time that I went to the wrong college?
Supposed to go 12 with some hard strides, but my right hamstring/groin wasn't working right. Sore? sharp? like something was catching? So I cut it. Oh well.
Hammy was better, but not perfect. Spending the day nurturing it i guess.

I gotta quit scheduling workouts for wednesdays... Something about trying to run fast right away in the morning blows. 3x(400, 600, 800) today, with 200m and a few seconds to gather myself after the 4 and the 6, and then 400m and a few seconds after the 8's. Didn't have goal paces, I kinda just wanted to float, but that obviously didn't happen. Felt so smooth on the first set, and then just bonked somewhere in the 2nd 800, and that was that. It was 80 degrees when I started my warmup, so that wasn't helping anything. And I'm sure yesterday's 18 wasn't an asset. Either way, rough. Also, the body glide I put on my legs eventually ran down into my shoes and the last 6 and 8 my feet were slipping around in some awful frictionless environment created by sweat and allantoin. 4x1minute hills after the workout, then cool down.

68, 1:45, 2:25
70, 1:51, 2:34 (ouch)

My odd cravings are back in full force, and dictated that for dinner I just eat a bowl of straight up spaghetti sauce packed dick-full of Cilantro. I was headed out for 6 or so, but after heaving a few times, and the rain started, my attitude of 'fuck it, does 3 more miles really matter?' came into play, and I just cut it. I'm really sleepy too. The run, work, run, sleep routine is grinding on me I think. As long as I get over the hundo this week I'll be fine. 110 is probably out of the question now, but we'll see. Oh well.

I was supposed to do a 20 mile progression (15 miles of speed) but roughly 6 (11) miles in it started to get rough. My lungs felt great, legs felt great, pace felt like a cakewalk. I just got a sharp, stabbing pain right in the middle of my right quad. Like a spasm kind of, and I went from being in pain, to limping, to not being able to lift my leg. So after 9.44 miles of the actual fast part, I just called it. I'm not really concerned about this, because it doesn't seem.... tendonitis-y. Unless it's a stress fracture. Anyway, I averaged 5:36 pace for those 9.44 miles and like I said, it felt breezy. So good and bad. I'll take it as a good sign though - I really felt like I could have held that pace for as long as I needed to.. and 10 miles of fast vs 15? eh... at least I got that much.

was going to do a 3 mile progression, something like 5:30, 5:10, sub 5 to make me feel better about today, but after the eating competition this afternoon I was full/sick as heck, so after the warm up I just ran home.
Strained my quad i guess? Going to take 2 days off and then just try to get back on track by sunday. This is a recovery week for me anyway. Good timing.

Somewhere between floating and working.... Don't really know what to think about this workout. I'm going to have to have a little more in the tank when I hit the button if I want to succeed this fall. Not bad for doing 16 last night though I guess.

I simply don't feel as strong as last fall, as dedicated, or like I'm running as much. I want it just as badly... I just feel like I can't get to the point of feeling invincible like I was last october. Month and a half. We'll see I guess.

From run n fun with the guys. Kelly, of all people broke up our 7:30 shuffle today. started racheting it down once we got to the river, and we fairly flew down summit averaging 5:45's. Nothing too taxing, but not what I wanted after yesterday. Going to abort the mile repeat plan for tomorrow, do something short and sharp on thursday, then maybe race saturday?

We'll see. fun run. And Dan Allen smoked the nookie supreme record tonight. 20:06. Baller.

After yesterday and the day before, Kelly suggested I run 8 minute pace today... Seems suuuuper slow, but hey, he has the olympic rings tattoo, not me. Figured I could try it. Still felt like horse dick.

I don't know what my deal is right now, but I'm just not in it mentally. Skipped last night's run cuz I was sore, exhausted, and hungry. Was still going to do it, but when I stepped outside it was raining. That was one more thing than I could handle, so I came inside, kicked off my shoes and wallowed.

Even getting out for this morning shakeout was a challenge. I don't want to say I don't care right now, but I just don't care. I feel like my training is spotty at best, and I'm not doing the things I need to do to be where I want to be in the fall. And if i'm not going to be able to step to the line with the same confidence that I had last fall, screw it.

And that's where I'm at right now.

Felt like fall out there. longish warmup, 15x1:2 fartlek, hitting the on portions pretty hard.

Figured with 2 days of sustained speed this week, I should do something raw, but not all together too taxing if I wanted to potentially race saturday. In trainers but still probably in the 4:3x-4:40 range for the on bits.
Just shagging around. Someone yodeled at me.

Let me tell you something about good decisions... So I was working until 10 last night, While there I was talking to dave and he suggested we go do a race somewhere this morning. Why not, yes? I'd tentatively planned on it anyway. So we looked around, and the Lino Lakes days 5k was today, and the winner got a $100 target gift card - and we figured some free groceries for our trip next weekend would be sweet. 

Then we decided to go out, have a beer, a shot of... rum? stayed out till 2 am, I drove people home, a chick puked in my back seat (into the waiting arms and shirt of a friend, much better than I'd ever be) and then we slept for... ALMOST 4 hours, drove to Lino Lakes and ran. I am NOT in 5k shape. Not that I was 'racing' by any means, but i was at least solidly moving. It was me, a UST kid, and then no one. HE took it out hard and I was winded and literally contemplated giving up by 400m, but he had back fat so I settled on his shoulder and hung out. Then I decided to not be a dick and just sit and kick, so at a bit before mile 1 I pulled away and yo yo'd the pace a bit to test him out. It was an out and back (turn around a cone) and a pretty technical course as far as paved trails go. Lots of hairpins, and a long, soft wood bridge. I pulled away from this kid just far enough to not hear his breathing, and anytime I could hear him I just surged again. Lead the rest of the way. 16:12, which, all things considered I'm ok with.easy 10 seconds off if it weren't for the sharp turns (including one in the kick) and then staying out late and no competition... Not bad.
Not sure how far this was, but 7 is safe. just shagged out some country roads, and then a few barefoot on the athletic fields. I miss running on gravel. Pavement blows.

Not sure exactly how far this was because the middle chunk was on some XC ski trails. Largely an out and back though. I wasn't going fast, but 20 is a safe guess. Mom and Jeff biked with me, and it was nice to be able to listen to conversation instead of having to come up with my own thoughts. Front of my right hip/inguinal groove area pretty sore and tight throughout. Not pleasant. I'll be icing it this afternoon. Off to the brewery tour!

No way is my GPS right on this one. The more you turn, the less accurate those things are. Going straight down river road? Sure it's fine. But if you're hacker-pschorr dunkling around god-knows-where it's far from right. at one point I checked it and it said I was running 8:47 pace. yeah, right. so I tested it out and picked it up to tempo pace for a few hundred.... 7:19. so I don't know what t call this run. I don't want to over estimate, but I know its more than the 12.39 told by the watch. I think i can sleep at night calling it 13. Felt good to be in adrenalines again actually.
morning shake out. Didn't quite feel like boiled moose cock this morning, so I think things are looking positive.

Was slated for the ol' 3x5k workout today, but with friday's workout looming, I wanted to not take the legs to the bank. Did 4x1mile, 4x200.

5:01
5:01
5:01

Kept it contained today, and it felt easy. the 200's were all 31's.

Helped to have Gangles there so I didn't feel like I was alone in the universe, even though we weren't running together. Also there were two chicks out there and we kinda cheered for each other a bit. John informed me that (at least one of them) was an OT qualifier. I kinda figured cuz they weren't moving slowly.

Not bad off a big week, a long day of work, and fairly just trotting.
Started out jogging, but after 4 miles or so I started actually running.  figured I should let the systems warm up a bit.

really sore, slow shuffle starting out. My calves felt like rocks. The only goal of this run was to loosen those suckers up for tomorrow. Ended up feeling like one of the most smooth runs in recent memory. feeling strong again. Summit to Grotto. out in 19:00, back in 17:25. Good signs, Good flow.
no lie, this felt pretty awful.... Chinese food much?

Hell day has arrived again... After some futile long workouts, lets see how this goes. 

AM:

mile warmup, 9 mile tempo (first 3@MP, last 6@HM)

first 3: 5:42
last 6: 5:18

2 mile cool down.

Felt fine. A little more tiring than I remember, but mostly I just felt weak psychologically. I really wanted to quit from boredom.

Hell day part 2.

Felt springy fresh, but apprehensive at the start. Rolled 3 miles at MP, roughly 5:45's, and then got on the track. Plan was 3x(800, 1000, 1600) at 5:20 pace with pretty limited recovery. JL was with on this, and I think that made a huge difference as we shared pacing duties. It's a lot easier to run repeats when you only have to think for part of them. Ended up going
2:37, 3:16, 5:21
2:40, 3:19, 5:20
2:39, 3:18, 5:07

Felt actually kind of enjoyable. We were on and off kinda chatty out there, which helped keep it light. I think, too (and we talked about this) that there's a very definite feedback loop with running. When it goes well, you get excited, which makes things feel better, which makes the reps go better, repeat, etc. Or if it's crappy, your beat yourself up, suck even more, beat yourself up more, etc.

Today was kinda sorta mostly fun. Cooler weather, having John, feeling good.... all culminates in a positive experience. The last mile I led through 800 in 2:40, then John took over - and apparently my race instincts. Maybe it was because it was the last rep.... but with 300 to go I felt good, and slammed down hard on the button. Jiggy-esque, if you will - just slower. my last 300 had to be 47-48, which is not that fast, but for how smooth it felt, and to cap off a 26.5 mile day? damn right I'll take it.
1 hours of the slowest shuffle I could manage.

This was only meant to be a supplementary run, but then I was so pissed after work and feeling sorry for myself that I drowned my sorrows in food and skipped my second run, effectively putting the cabosh on any sort of 3 digit week.

With John to God knows where and back. The first 7 kinda hurt, but after 10 they started passing pretty effortlessly, minus my really upset guts. Kinda odd. Some track-work at southwest with John. He wasn't planning this but I figured I'd toss out a line mid-day, and he bit. Glad he did, cuz I hate thousands, and probably would have started too fast and blown up if I did it solo. plan was 4 @ 3:12, then 4 @ 3:06 - but figured we'd have to adjust since it was windy - 18 gusting to 31. I led the first 400, he led the second 400 (my god that helps) and the last 200 we usually were side by side. A little pacing trouble on my part led to 3:08, 3:09, 3:11, 3:09, 3:05, 3:05, 3:05, 2:59. the last one we were probably a little hot throughout, but i kicked the last 100m and actually fairly flew. not sure when/how I developed a kick. odd. Then for giggles I ran a 200 all-out with whatever I had left, and it was 29.3. not sure what this all means for the marathon, but I felt strong, anyway.

Cold, windy. Felt really darn strong though. On the downside, it's supposed to be 30 degrees at race time. Oh, and windy.

around summit with JL watching the 10k. Balls was that cold. Got to hang out in the elite hospitality suite for a while, that was pretty cool. Showed Aaron Braun how to use the coffee maker. Oh, and Alberto Salazar was just causally jogging down Kellogg. Wasn't expecting that.
warm up around downtown. Feeling pretty baller, if I do recall.

I don't like taking the day after a hard effort off, so I forced myself out to stumble around for 2 miles. The first mile I thought someone was filleting my quads from my femurs. That, on top of it feeling like I actually had been pummeled by a baseball bat made for some interesting hobbling at 10 minute pace. I started to loosen up during the second mile, and I feel orders of magnitude better now. Good day. Gotta stay healthy now.
hips a little tight, but otherwise everything felt alright!
after thoroughly messing up my sleep schedule. Felt pretty good. Cedar, brownie, bike trails back.
for the two weeks i didn't log. Merica.
worth noting that today was a hodge podge 10 mile run with JL and some hispanic dude, and at one point we detoured and ended up running down a freeway in downtown minneapolis. Normal enough.

blasted this one between morning and evening deer hunting. Hard to train when you don't have a written plan, and nothing big on the horizon. I mean, Clubs, but lets be real, that's gonna suck no matter what.

all right. I guess it's back to this game. 

I'm not sure what I did anymore the past few weeks so I'll probably just toss out a lump sum so my annual mileage isn't SUPER off. somewhere in there I dicked around in a 5k - 5:08, mid 5's, the closed sub 5 just to be sure I could. leaned at the line and won by a minute. pretty close.

Tonigh I just wanted to see where I was at, after not running for the last two days, and hardly running before that. so I did 3 easy 4xmile with 3minutes jogging recovery, 3 easy.

5:10
5:10
4:55
4:50

Weird. Not sure how that happened.
running. cool.

I... drank too much and at one point woke up on Anders' floor spooning a fax machine. 

Winning?
screwed up my logging prior to this, everything was logged one day late. oh well. on track now.
6 hard strides after. form feels a little off.

was planning for 15, but then it was freezing so Kurt said 7. Now Kurt knows 7 is my least favpvorite distance and I generally refuse to run it. I said I'd do 5, 8, 10, whatever, so long as it wasn't 7. So hartman said, ok 5. Then we chose a route and it became four. Then we went to Patrick's and I had two breakfasts.

If I ever want to be good I need to learn how to take november training seriously.

3 up, 8x800 in 2:25's, with equal jogging recovery, 2 down. Solo, but my sister was there to yell at me for the first 6.

felt fine, but not as easy as I'd hoped. form feels a little sloppy too.

With a massive group from the store. No idea why everyone turned out this week.... Ran most of it with Ben and Choker, but we were together through a really slow first 3 - then Reneau and AC broke it up. Brandon went with. Wonder how that turned out. Maybe he stopped talking.

Eh.night run. Sucked per usual, but at least I was able to wear shorts. John got me out the door and through two, then I went off on my own. Tons of turkey trotters training for their first (or fastest!) 5k on the cedar lake trail and Isles. Groups of up to 15... Confusing. One guy told me to get out of his way... Excuse me? Eh... Looked at the watch at one point on Isles and was going 5:49s so I chilled a bit on the way in.
just a frolic
started with kurt, ran a few sub 6's easy, jogged in.
three distinct segments. first with JL, kurt, and the non-mexican prieve, secxond with Alex, third solo. feeling good.

What a beautiful day. High 50's, not a cloud in the sky. Drove over to St. Paul and ran River Road/Hidden Falls/Crosby and back. Absoultely floating. Chilled for 4 or so miles, then started ramping it down as the body felt like it. I don't know any splits - and granted this wasn't a 'workout' or anything special, but it was still unexpected. Miles 12 &13 were 5:50, and the last mile was 5:37.

6 x :15 all out hill sprints after.

Amen.

greenway to St. Paul, down toward the LSB. wanted to do 10x400 on the 3 minute, but didn't feel like going to the track, so i did 10x 1:2, keeping the recovery honest. Started probably 8k pace, got down to roughly 800 pace. Felt pretty fast tonight. hopefully the marathon to 5k/10k transition will happen sooner rather than later.
From the store with Jiggy. The team was quite literally spread across the whole city tonight.
Felt fricken awful. Late, tired, hunrgy. Just didn't want to be doing it.
With Johnny around the lakes. fricken cold.

Around Harriet and Calhoun with Victor. Good change of pace, good conversation. Chafed my taint. Less than fun.

Legs felt really good today. Probably should have done something fast. Oh well.
ran today, but it sucked. not sure how far. not very.
2x3mile easy progression (6:00, 5:30, 5:00) 1 mile between.
from the store - with Ben Jacobs, Jiggy, and Jack Diechert. Turns out that even after time off, Jack is not a pussy. Would I bet against him going sub 4 in the mile this year? nope.
with Jack and John. Felt fine. Good to have company because man this constant darkness blows.
harriet with Johnny. Was going to add on, but i didn't feel good, and... why? It's november.

cedar bike trail to the river, across stonearch, through U of M proper, back over washington, get lost in downtown, and then back on bryant. Downtown at night in the winter is kinda magical - likewise, nicollet mall is kinda colorful, and I couldn't make out many words, but they were far from, 'Wow, great job. Way to be out running tonight.'
Bachelor party all day. Paintball, sprinting down grand ave.... Counts, right?
Felt good. Cool route.
Frolicking down the greenway

Ran down to the southwest track for some quarters. Figured it wouldn't be the worst idea ever to do a little bit of speed before I jog out at nats. Hard to get out there when it's 20 degrees, dark, and you're solo. Turns out it's actually tough to run fast in tights. Pretty restrictive. Did 8x400 on the three minute. Jogging recovery. 

69, 69, 68, 68, 68, 67, 68, 64.
Along the creek with Jack. Company and conversation help make these day, unmotivated runs go by. God bless the TC running community.
crash course tapering.... 6 hard strides after
on the course in Lexington... Tomorrow is going to be a mud bath.
Terrible out so I went inside, but it was a million degrees and this bro who kept looking at himself in the mirror really started to get to me. and the TV's weren't working. Got angry, went home.
all day  wedding. friggin' matrimony.
from TCTC with their team. Pretty cool group of guys, feels good to broaden the running network a little.
wore flats for this, cuz why not? loop of the lakes. felt fine.
lots of snow to run through on this one. The idiocy of my current training suggests that I could again do the christmas break 100 miles in singles, but probably not.

slow, a bit of recovery. felt really good though. six hard strides after.

This has been my most IDGAF training stretch of 2012. Hopefully I can focus a little bit here.

3 mile warm up on the hamster wheel, 2x(4x800) w/ 400 jogging recovery, 800 jog between sets, continuous running (streak xc's), 2 mile cooldown

straight 2:24's and 2:25's. didn't feel 'smooth' per say, but I also didn't feel like I was ever really working, definitely never went to the well. good workout effort.

2nd avenue run. Finally got this route right. Pretty sweet cuz you get a little taste of everything: Lakes, bike trail, west bank, east bank, stonearch, river road, downtown, and neighborhoods. Felt sore, but strong. Form was smooth. The bottom of my right foot was a bit irritated (the fascia toward the ball) which makes sense being that my shoes have a few miles on them, did the workout yesterday, all the recent slipping on the ice, and the fact the the shoes I wore to work today are completely flat. Lesson learned.

Matt Wiersum is back from China so I met him for a jog around harriet and some beers after. He's just building back up and didn't want to go farther, and I figured with my fascia soreness of yesterday, having a down day was alright. Good conversation. What a corrupt, fucked up place china is...

The square. Was going to do some pick ups once I got to the greenway, but that sucker was glazed with ice. my achilles and feet in general are a bit sore from 5 miles of that shit. I need to get on a track asap.
Felt good, but i'm tired of all these lackluster space filler runs. But between my motivation level and the icy conditions, doing much else is tough. I'll get on the track eventually.

easy breezy around the cities. first 7 was with little Kate down to the creek and around harriet, then I went off to stonearch and back via cedar lake. went by really quickly, and some woman on a bike told me to 'go get 'em kid', and then when I passed her again on the other side of minneapolis she gave a fist pump and told me 'you're going to be a star'... I do this every day love. But uplifting, nonetheless.

A bit hasty, but a fine way to get rid of a hangover. 2 or 2.5 easy, then just picked it up more and more until the end. Last mile was 4:52. Felt pretty strong, few hard strides after. Still feel like I'm lacking the top end. Wasn't planning on going fast but I had a 5'2' blonde reason to get home a little quicker :-)

definitely can account for the slow pace due to the road conditions, and maybe the latter miles. Ran over to GEAR running store in edina and met up with the TCTC guys. ran 2 laps around harriet, back to the store, drank a beer, had some celebratory whiskey in honor of Joe and Steph who are on their way out to cross country worlds right now, and then drunk sprinted the 3 and a quarter back home. felt light, anyway.
easy run with Matt to the creek and back via harriet. added on 4 more after dropping him off. felt good, but I don't think I had eaten anything before this.

Minneapolis Proper.

Fack that's huge loop. Pretty much circled every part of minneapolis that doesn't have an adjective. CLBT on the north, the river on the east, the creek on the south and the lakes on the west.

Tired, but strong enough.

6 mile tempo around calhoun with Jack, Adrian, and Victor. Always fun to do spur of the moment workouts with people. Was a little concerned with yesterday's 20, and today's chipotle/coffee combo, but all was well, minus some heartburn. Kept it light, pushed a bit the last mile but kept it smooth and stayed away from the well. splits were 6:10, 5:50, 5:33, 5:30, 5:28, 5:10 by my watch. I feel like I need to do some shorter, all-out speed, and I'll be ready to race.

Trial of Miles.

getting really sick of your shit minnesota.

10 hard strides after
with RnF. I'll backfill later

5 with John and kurtmahjad priebrinkmanship, 5 by myself on the greenway. Was planning on running some fast 400's or at least some hard minutes, but fuck if that half inch of snow today didn't pecker-punch my brownstar. no footing anywhere.

You win some, you lose some, then you die.

at the dome to get in a little speed, even though the surface kinda blows. anyway, one lap is a little over 600m, not exactly sure how much, but it can't be a lot. I know one lap right down the center is 640m, and the inside track is 'just over'. did a warmup, and then made my workout up based on how I felt. 2x600+, 4x400, 4x200. the 200's were exact, because Lance elliot was there (that old dude can roll... 4:01 1500 in his 40's?) and taped them off. He said he wanted to run 32's for his 200's, so that was my plan, but then he blew me out of the water.

Ran into Kotek right as I was starting - and I convinced him to do my workout with me. He wasn't really able to hit the splits I was looking for, but starting with him, and running close enough to hear kept me going. 

Mike and Joe were there too, wouldn't have minded doing Joe's workout with him, but I didn't get there till 6 and he was about done. ran with them for the warmup though.

600's were 1:41, 1:43
400's were all 64-67
200's were 29.8, 29.6, 30.0, 30.1
slow and easy. the week of ten milers I guess

sustained winds of 38, gusting to 53.... ran dead into them for my last 8 miles. 

frozen penis.
Colder than a whale's penis.

On the hamsterwheel. warmed up, clicked the speed up one time at the end of each song, until mile 8, which I decided to run in 5:00, just for giggles, then cooled down.

Still, f*ck MN and it's -20 bullshit.

I'm feeling hostile.

Ran at the dome with Jack

16x400 at a quick but relaxed pace w/200 jogging recovery, continuous workout.

straight 70-72, closed my last 200m in 31 for a 67. Felt good. exhausting, but the kind of tired where I could have done 10 more if you held a gun to my head.

Pretty sweet to sync up workout with Jack too - reason number 1,000,000 that living in minneapolis is sweet.

icy and -21 windchill.

cold penis.

Jack was doing a workout today and it gave me a reason to leave work early, so I took him up on it.

4x 2.5 miles with 2:30 jogging recovery. it was like 2 above, windchill of -9, and running fast in tights is less than fun. my first rep was about 600m short because I had to poop, then my second was about 800m short because I had to poop. Finished the other two, and less my GI issues, legs and lungs felt peachy out there.

Jack has the actual splits, but we were between 5:28 and 5:37 pace the whole time. Gettin out the door.

Frosty.

Had to be the slowest run ever. I felt fine, recovered and all that jazz, but I just couldn't have cared less about running. and it was cold, and dark, and I had no idea where I was. I ended up running through the sculpture garden though, which was at least part of the plan.

What a messed up day. Up all night, eating was thrown off, slept from 2-4:45 in the afternoon and then did this.

I feel like a whole bag of dicks.

sleeting out, and I figured it would be a better idea to meet up with bartley and see what hollow point, home defense zombie rounds for my .40 caliber would do to various household objects than go running. I was right.
Just a frolick around in the snow with JL and Adrian... and his dog.

At the dome. Workout was 4x800, 6x200. Because someone took down Lance's tapemarks, it was actually 4x808m, 6x202m. felt good on the warmup, but my legs were heavy as soon as I started. I knew during strides it would be a struggle when I just couldn't.... flow without breathing hard. But I got it done, right about on goal pace.

2:17, 2:20, 2:21, 2:22. shave a second or so for the extra 8 meters I'd guess.

30, 31, 31, 31, 31, 30

so freezy breezy they just call me the windchill.

finished respectably, but I started SOOOOO slow cuz it was 2 degrees, windchill of -12 outside, and I was going to treadmill, even though relatively that isn't THAT terrible. I just didn't wanna be cold. Left my pass at home, so I overdressed majorly and just shuffled. and tomorrow is going to be 14 degrees colder. sweet.

surrendered to the cold and ran in the dome. You legit can't be outside for more than 3 minutes without wanting to kill yourself. -30wc or something? Went farther than 9, but went by time, so who knows. ran for different amounts of time with JL, Phil (the thrill), delehanty, and jiggy JACK. Felt like a pussy because marotz and delehanty were both doing pretty baller workouts, and I was just trotting flashing the bright whites for the ladies. Oh well. not the right time to do a workout. did a few hard strides after and felt really fast.
after work, on the treadmill with John. I had no music, and there was just a wall in front of me so I was going crazy. Stopped at 5.

***RACE***
Race Name: Ted Nelson Classic
Terrain: Not Specified
Warm Up: 3 miles
Race Splits: 34.2, 35, 35.3, 34.8, 35.1, 35.5, 36, 36.2 (4:42), 36.4, 36.6, 37.3, 37.9, 37.4, 37.4, 35.1
Cool Down: 3 miles

Just died the slow death. Pretty anxious in the early laps, a lot of jostling and moving around, probably didn't help anybody. through the mile in 4:42 by assistant coach John's watch, and I still felt really good. Monkey jumped on with 800 to go - far too early for him to hitch a ride, and that was that. Still fun. Next time.
really reallly slippery. The brown shit, as John called it. Still full from breakfast, heartburn... A lackluster end to a lackluster week. I need spring in a bad way.
With J, bumped into Victor too. last 3 by myself, felt really good.

At the U of M with Zwick and Marotz for a workout. 4x1000, 2x400

the first K was steady, controlled fast pace
the second was controlled with a surge for lap 3
the third was controlled with a surge for lap 3
the fourth was controlled and kicking the last lap

400's were fast, but not going to the well.

2:56, 2:54, 2:56, 2:53, 65, 65

2 minutes of recovery.

Not the best workout of my life, but went well enough. Pretty cool to have people to run with again. Damn Jiggy closed his last one (he did 5) in a 30, for a 2:52... always outdoing me.

I was pissed off about this run while I was still putting my socks on. O/B through the industrial wasteland that is the eastern Cedar Lake Trail. at one point I was running sub 6's (this whole run was through snow) just cuz I wanted it over so badly. Here's to the start of another long ass semester.
with JL around downtown. paths were about as sloppy as they could have been, less a few stretches.

I actually think I have a little seasonal affective setting in. I'm never outside in the daylight, and my emotion oscillates between kinda down on life to wanting to watch the city burn. 

I don't have the will power to make running a chore right now, but I really want to start running actual mileage again. If it doesn't get warm soon, I'm going to start torturing animals or Prieve family members. 

Here's to brighter days.

***RACE***
Race Name: UWRF Warren Bolus Open
Terrain: Not Specified
Warm Up: 3 miles, strides
Race Splits: 68, 2:17, ?, 4:37
Cool Down: 4 miles pretty fast
Overall Place: 9

No idea what I was doing here. Apparently mid-d guys are agressive? I got elbowed a dozen times in the first 4 or 5 steps and was in last place through the curve. I sprinted down the straight because I wasn't going to run 5 minutes, and I wanted position, so I tucked in about 6th or so (still lane two). Remembered what JL said about getting anxious, so I ran even until the 1000, and which point I started to get kinda tired/antsy and wondered when I should go for it. Turns out I'm a vag and didn't go untill 300 out, but that didn't even matter because I can't sprint around the curves. Been away from the track too long. To next time.
Blizzard. That is all.
work all day, school all evening, then running when it's dark, im hungry, and it's cold out is going to kill me. Ran inside tonight to the new macklemore album.

Went to the U to roll off a pretty relaxed workout - 3 mile w/u,

1 mile: 4:55
2x800: 2:22, 2:25
2x400: 67, 67
200: 29

I think the idea here was to just coast and feel good - the mile felt like jogging. I was relativelt sure I'd see 5:30 when I crossed the line. Surprisingly easy. then I ran in lane 1 for the 800's, and fuck if that didn't crush my legs. I know I've mentioned this before, but I just can't take the turns. after two of them I felt zapped. Heavy. Yuck.

the 1 minute of recovery went out the window with the 400's because I ate all that chili for lunch, and, well you can fill the rest in.

Whatever. Friday will happen.

35 and raining, 8pm. Cool. The highlight of this run was the random dude in the woods up at Cedar Lake in the huge black survival suit looking thing. Not saying he was a walker for sure, but if I had a gun I'd have given him one in the dome just to be safe.

Icy and cold and dark.... I'm noticing a theme. I wish I were excited about tomorrow, but I'm not yet. I think a big part of that is that I feel like I'm just in maintanence mode right now, and have been all winter. That said, I feel like I don't deserve to be running fast. Sure I'll go give it everything I have, but I have some definite cognitive dissonace between what I'm doing (dicking around, getting out the door each day) and who I am inside as far as training goes (see: jdelehanty). I definitely will get back to it again, I just don't have it in my soul when it's cold out, and I have work and school. Excuses... Translate: I'm kinda a bitch. But it;s fun enough, I'm healthy, and give me 6 weeks of actually doing aomething and I'll round into form.

Good day.

***RACE***
Race Name: U of M snowshoe open
Terrain: Not Specified
Warm Up: 3 miles
Race Splits: 3:04, 6:02, 9:00
Cool Down: 3 miles
Overall Place: 8/21

Love me some 9 minute 3k's... So, they figured it's be pretty sweet to put 21 guys in a single 3k heat on an indoor track. We did alley starts, and I was on the inside. The outside got out ahead of us, and when they collapsed in I found myself nicely shitcanned in the back. Not usually a problem, but when we were running 37 second laps, it becomes an issue. Spent a lot of time in lanes 2 and three, and once made a desperate attempt to get around the shit and ran in lane 4. Good tactics. Anyway, running 10 minute mile pace was conducive to some light chatting with Colin Rogers. I saw Leaf and gave him a headshake accompanied with some pointing at the pack - he mentioned something about 'hanging out' and I knew he got my predicament. Everyone tucked in on the curve and surged on the straights so it was literally impossible to get around anyone. So Merchant and I just kept on galloping along in the back. Stopped looking at my splits - Oh, and they set up hurdles in lane 3 when we (I) was still running in it. That was neat. Anyway, with 1k to go I was in 20th, finished in 8th. It may have been a slow time, but I raced well for the situation, and wasn't tired at the end. Some people just race like idiots.
Frosty frolick with little kate, JL, and kurty. Solo the last 7 or so. Lakes, ran over to southwest high to to look at the track... under a foot of snow and people had been running laps. only in MN.

10 miles with little Kate down the CLT to stone arch and back through downtown. Then I dropped her off back at home and took Kings down to the creek and hacked neighborhoods back. 7:30's with Kate, progressive for my solo 7. I know my last 2 miles were both sub 6:20. just wanted to get home. felt fine.
on the hamster wheel

At the U indoor track. 4xmile, 4x200, and then a few minutes into my cool down Billig asked if I'd pace him to a 3:00 1k, which I did, in trainers, and it was beyond easy. Crazy how mindset can change how effort feels. anyway, 

4:58, 4:58, 4:56, 4:53, 29, 29, 30, 30, 3:00

The miles I went totally by feel, didn't check any of the splits. Wanted to go under 4:50 for the last one, - easy first half and then hammer it home, but my guts went to liquid after a lap and that notion went out the window. Well enough, I suppose.
Slowest run of my adult life. I just did NOT want to be out there. So i truffle shuffled like a bitch.

Jack had some swing miles tonight. 10 miles of 5:50,5:20,5:50, 5:20, etc. and got me out the door to do it with him. Good stuff, just biding my time until it's warm again. The south end of calhoun was shitty, but aside from that it was alright

I made it 9.3 miles because I had to poop during mile 3 and Jack kept going. These times are from Jack's watch because I accidentally deleted mine. Differences I know of: My last mile was 5:18, not 5:10 and... somewhere in the 3rd mile I stopped.

5:46/5:23
5:52/5:09
5:45/5:20
5:47/5:21
5:54/5:10

Good day. Jack is pretty fricken strong right now.

standard downtown loop. good stuff. Actually had some fun tonight - I raced the northstar line from target field to the river, and it beat me. I'm pretty sure I could have taken it but I'd have had to dig and I didn't think that was a good idea tonight. I slid down the hill at the old mill ruins, and frolicked through downtown on the way back. even with the snow emergency, everything was clear until Loring park, then it was absolutely miserable. Doesn't help that the flow's are scrotum yodelers in the snow. My IT's are screaming at me now. Probably best that Johnald ran inside today.

With JL westward on the greenway. Ran past the most extravagant tree fort I've ever seen, on TV or otherwise, and learned John was anti-semetic.

Oh the places you'll go.
around the cities, northward, with John. Feel really out of it on this run. Drunk, like. I was hoping for at least 16, maybe 18, but we were short on time to get to Ike's for all you can eat brunch.
just ambling around after night class. I hate monday and wednesday. Wednesday is supposed to be like 37 degrees and sunny, but nope.... I'll be in class. Life, I guess.

At the U. First, I just think it's so awesome how solid of a running community we have here. MN sucks balls in the winter for training, but the people that still do it, do it hard, and that makes it great. Just standing in the entrance to the track, watching the USA MN girls doing their thing, Lance ambling around being way too fast for his age, Jack rolling off K's, Ben Jacobs 'coaching' aka running 600's solo, and the general energy that is this little above freezing oasis that is the U of M track in February made me happy.

This workout was not as fun as I thought it'd be. I hit generally the times I wanted to, but it wasn't as easy as running these times has been in the past.

4x200 @ floating, 4x400 @ fast, 5k, 5k, fast, 4x200 @ 30ish

32, 32, 32, 33
64, 72, 70, 64,
30,29,30,29

Just felt kinda heavy.
In Ames with JL. Iowa. Bumpin'.
Good long run to the creek, over to river road with John. Felt strong and easy and all that jazz. beautiful day. good run to make me feel slightly less sorry for myself after yesterday.
just running... felt fine.
Suuuuuuuper slippery. 3 solo, got lost around west 7th, and then ran 10 with the guys from the stroe. Good group.
class went late, work sucked, and it was dark and really cold. pussed out.

5 miles solo and really angry about running, then went to RnF with Dave to get him new shoes, then 7 more with John around the lakes. The second part felt really good, and I was back to being happy. The first part, I wanted to hurt things.

tagged along for John's workout, 3x8minute tempo. Ran into prez and he came with for the middle one. 38 degrees and sunny - felt good to not have to wear tights finally. lots of snow/slop/ice still, though. tried to sit off John's shoulder and just hang because I didn't want to be the one pushing pace. 5:50, 5:40, 5:24. felt good.

with JL, short tack-on solo. few strides. 38 and raining, thouroughly soaked out there. Lots of puddle splashing. 

Seems the economy is hitting tangletown hard....

With John for 16, then tacked on four. Felt pretty good, but happy to be done. A lot of stupid conversation out there, but what else do you do? Fell right in front of our house and took a chunk out of my knee. Nifty.

I pretty much refuse to double until I don't have to bundle up. So I guess this us how it's gonna be if I want to get any millage in. Quick where it was clear, shuffled where it was icy. Bumped into victor and ran one slow mile with him after his workout.
With run n fun. Basically walking down summit where it was icy. Good group tonight.
really eased into this one. All the runoff had melted by the time I went out there, and running over clear ice in the dark made for slow travels. felt pretty springy.
Ran with Greeno - Great conversation, pretty encouraging I think. Right calf was good until the very end.
with kurt. I just didn't have time for any more than this today.

ran the get lucky 7k as something of a workout where I thought I'd be held accountable. well, by the 1k I had a 50m lead and it wasn't going to collapse. SO i messed around (18 degrees and the roads were pure ice, unsalted) so I trotted 5:20's waved to cameras, fist bumped some dude, and won by over a minute. neat. What a stupid event.

Who joseph, leighton and johnald out to the cleveland steamer in St. Padre. Fuck highway 99. On a less terrible note, I'm somewhat convinced I met my future last night... As long as spraying beer all over her face wasn't a deterrent. Really though. This girl... I've never felt something like that before.

one of those mythical creatures of a run where your legs are going to do absolutely anything you want them to. weightless. The majority of this was over that wonderful new 6-8 inches of snow we got today, and the negative windchill. 30 mph winds? enough, minnesota. ready for summer.
cold as dick. THis winter is never going to end. MOstly with Jiggy from the store, but some other company mixed in. felt good.
2 warm up, then I was feeling good so I settled into a light 5:45 pace for the next 7, then jogged home.
Went down to check on Harriet. She's still there. Got yelled at to get off the bike path. Spring is in the air.
Along the creek with John. Felt a bit sluggish, but less race-tired and more basement party drinking to much tired.

In south Padre with Anders, Dave, and Val. Our first mile we ran with some dudes from new Mexico who shared their beers with us as we ran. Pretty sweet. One actually held on for a while, but he was trying to bang Val. Cool guys, though. After two miles of just messing around Anders and I actually did some real running.
The is going to be a long week training-wise.... Not sure how it's gonna play out. Sucks for running down here. One street, and it's a straight line for as many miles as you can imagine.

Just decided to get it over with. Figured out a point way the hell out on the out and back (there were snow plows out clearing the sand dunes that had covered the road....) and just went with it. 30mph winds, at my back on the way out, in my face on the way back. shitty. tried to keep it chill.

7.75 mile tempo in 42:54 avg 5:32 pace. out in 5:25's, back in 5:39's against the wind. 

High fived some hot chicks in a car who were driving about.. 50 and stuck their hands out. but hey. spring break mf'ers.
beach frolic with Anders
motivation is really dwindling here....

80, humid, and not a cloud in the sky. was supposed to do some short hills, but I'm on an island and there are no hills here. So Anders and I did 10x250m build ups, which varied in length cuz we did them on the long straight (only) road here. So miserable here in the heat. Well enough.
just ran 30 minutes on the beach. motivation killed.
back from texas, done being blackout drunk every day, and back to training, I guess. Did this after getting up at 5 and sitting on a plane all day.

3.25 up with Johnny, 7x 2:30 on, 2:00 off solo, cool down.

No idea how fast I was running. Probably about 8k pace. Hit 10 miles in 1:04:16, so with warm up and jogging I couldn't have been going that slow.
chasin' that dream.
my one hour gap between meetings. 14 hour day of work. ish.
With Anders. Good run, good company. Felt nice to have someone to drag me out the door into the rain. 5 hard strides after. All out, and anders still put 30 yards on me. I hope he's sore tomorrow.
Holy heartburn. Just a shakeout in chicago with Greeno, Kampf, BJ, and Jiggy, but that jimmy johns I ate was not happy with me. Felt pretty terrible for most of this.

really easy through 10, but at mile 10 I felt weightless, and like no matter what I was running downhill. decided to race some bikers for a while. so this run was probably all 7:0x's with 2 sub 6's in there. good day.

Told Anders I'd rabbit him for a mile TT - turns out it was a shitty day, windy and rainy and wet and gray and gross. But we did it cuz we're awesome. Ran down to SW and met him at the track with Dave and JL. He said he wanted a 2:14 half, and I brought him around in 2:13.8 - 66 and change, 67 and change. A little hot the first 100, otherwise really even. Then I dropped off and Dave took him through lap 3, then I jumped back in for the kick. For once in my life I MAYBE, MAYBE could have buried Anders Bowman... after taking a lap off. He finished in 4:26.33, crazy for just starting training and no real speed. Anyway, did that, had 2 200's in there too. kind of just a mess around day - 7 mile cool down. Had a lot of fun, actually.

Today was sweet: John ran sub 26 a few weeks ago, I just ran 25:06, Anders pulled a 4:26 out of his arse today, James is in constant beast mode so he'll be fine.... Is it to early to be excited from cross alumni? is it too early to talk crap?
Four solo, then ten with Anders and Dave. Sweet run, awesome night with them
Solo for five before meeting Anders and save and doing 8 with them. Pretty slow, didn't mind the recovery. Didn't have a GPS on it, but this is safe. 4 strides after.
With John for the first 11. Just getting through it.
Down in St. Pete With Kate and Lyndsi. Did some of Kate's workout with her. Got a bit drunk last night... Just a shakeout.

4x7 minutes w/ 2 minutes jog. With JL and Victor. Nothing crazy, but good enough. My guts felt pretty terrible, otherwise everything was good. 

5:36 pace,

With John and Demitri. started in the sleet, which turned in hail, back to sleet, to snow, and then finally rain. Cold, windy, apparently this makes you tough? time will tell.

Melloglaze after, which is what really mattered.
Felt impatient. Just going through the motions and filling in the squares. out in 34:10, back in 31:23
stiff legged amble on LoTIO/B

Progression run from the store. 4 easy, 4 at 5:40, 4 at 5:20 was the goal, but I couldn't hold steady pace with hitting some pretty solid hills. So I went by effort.

Not hyper easy, but felt fine, generally. The last 3 miles were heading east on summit, so... Not fun.
With Dave, class went late, had my identity stolen, pouring rain. Fuck this much?
took 2 and a half hours to get home with traffic and the blizzard. Just... couldn't

8x1:2 with Anders. great weather, planned on doubling but I also didn't know the concert was at 5:30 tonight...
With big A... just crushin some big miles for him! Creek, nokomis, harriet, calhoun and some neighborhood dick dangling.
pretty slow going in places, because MN pulled that springtime blizzard shit again. Anytime I ran north I had to keep my eyes closed. Painful. just hodged the podge around south MPLS

workout down at SW with johatma and Theis. Wore shorts even though it was 40, windchill of low 30's... but hey, it's MN and we're desperate. The wind on the backstretch was a real energy suck, but otherwise it was ok. Legs were a bit cold. 5x800, 3x400, 3x200 w/2:30 rec. NEver went to the well, just a good moderately hard effort throughout.

the time for this is made up, and this run was just by GPS at Hamline while watching the guys 10k. Ran a bit with Seph on his warmup, zigzagged on the infield, ran during the race, cooled down with Metz and joe both for a bit. Me joe and Bart (in dress shoes) decided it was in our best interest to run an all out 400 on the track in the dark because it would be realtively even - or so we thought. Joe just raced 10k, I was tying up a 15 mile day and have no leg speed, and bart had on jeans and dress shoes. Joe put on a clinic and came home in 59 (put 7 seconds on me in the last 275) I ran 66, bart was 68.

Good times.
up around isles. uneventful. cold. tights and a jacket.
With John, Dave and Anders. My right achilles is less than perfect. going to have to watch that.
achilles was swelling and not great during this... cut it really short - going to put it through the ringer tomorrow. Here's to hoping...

No warm up, Gustie alumni mile. I ran pretty hard for the first 120m as a joke, since I knew no one wanted to have to go fast. Then I slowed the pace to a literal shuffle around 200 to see if anyone wanted to go around, and they didn't. SO I went back to a light, quick pace until 700m where I threw in a 75 or so meter surge and gapped the field except erica's boyfriend who was to some degree racing seriously. He came with and I pulled him into the bell at an almost reasonable pace. Went over the water barrier and cannonballed into the steeple pit. soaked up to my collar bones. Erica's bf went over it like a normal human and put 20m on me before I could climb out and start plodding again. I celebrated down the back stretch, tried to high-five some guy, and sommersaulted across the finish line.

Fun stuff :)

Spent 2 hours down at Patrick's getting drunk, and then came back and ran a leg of the 4x400. No warm up, no strides. Just spikes, and take the baton. ran 63.1, but probably split something like 28 high, 34... No idea on that, just guessing. I got the baton from Anders and sprinted as hard as I could. Was in oxygen debt with the monkey firmly on my back with 300 to go. Pretty scary feeling. But an awesome new tradition, i think!

a bit shy of 15 most likely. With Anders and JL, working off one hour of sleep and some incredible previous night activities... We were all dead, and I was concerned the Anders might actually die in the last half mile. Achilles not great, will keep working on it. It was terrible, and hot and tiring and dehydrated and my legs were spent, but there is just no way to really complain about a lap of Ramble On with great friends.
beautiful day, and I felt pretty bulletproof. first mile was the only one that wasn't sub 6, then I just cruised along at 5:50ish the rest of the way. never felt a thing. some interesting heckles...
after finishing my run I figured it wouldn't be a horrible idea to jog a little and cool down or something.
Around seward with Johnny. beautiful day once again.
morning shakeout in the rain. Just getting moving.

Solo workout, 15x1:1. Started a bit faster than mile pace, but quickly ramped that down below 800 pace, and by number ten I was pretty much flat out sprinting, albeit cautiously. Number 14 I went straight to my ceiling and had this weird feeling that there may be a tad more there. Felt fully recovered after my minute off, and on number 15 I blew the doors off. I found some gear that would probably make big Anders proud. The downside was that around 42 seconds, that gear locked up, and the monkey climbed on. Spent my last 20ish seconds tying up and picking carrots, as Henderson would say. Good day. Feeling bulletproof again. Untouchable. The scary part was that I felt like I could aerobically sustain my sprint. Awesome :)
Wwith anders and dave. The only thing that needs to be taken away from the run was the fact that I slapped a goose. Twice.

Just a slow 10 around Wirth park. Coolest thing about Wirth is that even if just for a few miles you're pretty sure you're in Brainard or somewhere, but now and then you can see the downtown skyline. Raining, gray, 36 degrees.

With John and Jack up Wirth through Golden Valley, across to far Northeast and back via cedar. Tacked on down to calhoun and back after. Felt good the whole way through. Got to run through the animal walk up there somewhere... about a billion dogs. Victory parkway was a nice change of pace. Good day, good conversation.
super easy through the neighborhoods with John. Great morning.

Beautiful sunday afternoon, and as I was walking out the door Bartley iced me. Had one taped to the storm door... So I chugged the damn thing, puked at the tin fish, and again by the cedar lake beach. Fucker. Awful.

But Marit said yes :)

Jogged down to SW with Johnny. When we got there, some elementary track clubs were practicing, which was originally pretty irritating but turned out to be one of the more uplifting experiences I've had in a long time. The coaches were kind enough to let us have lanes one and two, and we only had to dodge kids twice. It was awesome running with them on our recovery jogs, fake racing them during that time, high fiving, cheering for each other... fun to see so many little kids doing a sport I love. Pretty inspiring both directions, I think. Anyway, we did 16x400 with 200m jog and 30 seconds of passive recovery. A lot of rest, just wanted to keep them under 70 and keep them feeling easy. switched leads every 2.

Out and back with John from RnF. Beautiful running through Crosby farm and hidden falls.
down to harriet, met up with the TCTC guys, ran with them, argued with Mike, felt like shit when he said he was at 84 in 4 days, went back to GEAR, drank too much, drunk ran home.
dickin' the dog around the lakes, creek, etc. Calf causing trouble still.
My calf is destroyed. neeeeeeeeat.
Not so hot. Body felt great, still feels like I have a jumper cable latched onto my lower leg.
around isles with Marit. This run felt alright. 4 hard strides after. Nothing like an awesome stretch of training to prep a person for Kraft.
From the store, mostly with Marotz. No pain today. Small victories.

Shaking some of the sand out. Tired, but felt good. 

Operation Hurricane starts now. 94 days.
Hurricane. 94.
Getting back in the routine. Overslept. 93.
Standard. Good run... With John and Andy for a bit. 93.

Shagged my way out to the Cedar Lake trails and decided I should probably do a workout. First and last time I do a workout in Vomeros. Sandbags, and zero energy return. Did some numbers from a hat, 10min, 3x3min, 4x1min with varying recovery. The 10 minutes were at 5:09 pace, the other I didn't check. Including my 4 mile warm up and recovery jogging, I split 1:02:26 through 10 miles, so I had to be going fast somewhere.

Saw Reneau and his gf Steph Price on the river.... cute.

I figure Vomeros on river road is similar to spikes in the Arb, and I cant imagine it's going to take more than 5:09's to win :)

92.

With Johnny on the creek.

91

With Anders fricken Bowmen, of all people. The big guy did it. I felt as good at the end as at the beginning. Eeeeeeeeasy.

90.
Shaking out. A little stiff at first, but feeling strong. 89 baby.
With John and Kurt. Feeling strong as ever. Don't know about fast, but I'm feeling good. 89.
Easy morning jaunt with little Kate. 88.
A bit short of what I was planning on, but Marit was biking with, and it was raining, so I was fine with it being short. Not a big deal. 88.

ran from work on a strange impulse. When I got back our nurse said, 'Oh. I saw all your paperwork laying out, your clothes and shoes on the floor and figured you must have gone running. Or streaking. Which, for you, are equally probable.'

Damn right.

87.

In the rain with Anders. Got totally soaked... Three hour turn around from my 'morning' run.
The fire's hot.
87.

West on the creek with John. Really nice route. Mid 50 degrees. Great were it not for the 60 chicken wings and 8 beers I had last night. But hey, being this awesome comes at a price. Shout out to Anders and Kurt for our combined over 150 wings eaten.

86.

A bit quick on the pace, but after seeing a 9th grader run 8:58 and benning drop from 9:30 to 9:02 @ state, I was a bit riled up, to say the least. Wtf.

Bumped into jack, nice to have a few miles with some thoughts other than my own

85.

Third mile was 4:54 because I was irritated from the state meet results. I'm such a pussy.

85

Easy jaunt along the creek with dan Allen.

84.

Hadn't really done any long tempo/progression work leading up to this half, and it was starting to make me nervous, so I threw one out today. A little shorter than I'd hoped, but by the end of I was sick of the relentless rain and the heavy, wet feet... figured I didn't need to fight it any longer. Also, It was nice that Dan Allen just happened to be in town, so we ran together for the first 11 miles or so. I think the cumulative fatigue just got him a little - he's definitely fit right now. I didn't have a plan for this run, except that the first 5 would be easy, and then either start at 6's and ratchet it down, or hold steady depending on how I felt. Ended up with a little of both. Felt totally in control and really strong all the way through, which is  good sign? I guess?

Relentless rain... Second night in a row that I woke up around midnight and couldn't fall asleep again because my legs are too sore. It's like my skin is to tight for my muscles. But once I start running again they are fine... Hopefully it's just the inflammation that happens with recovery.

Just going through the motions. Four strides after.

With John, reneau, and erichsen for a bit. erichsen has the widest gap, proportionally, between length of running shorts and marathon pr. Ever see a 2:16 guy in knee length shorts? Me either. Reneau seems pretty confident he can win Grandma's.. We'll see I guess. Didn't like how my hips felt at the beginning of this. half dozen strides after.

Short double. Bit of a recovery day. Watched the uptown crit after, and it was incredible. Unbelievable athletes, fascinating tactics.

morning shake out. feeling good.

A little speed with Johnny out on Cedar Lake trail. 2x2miles with whatever for recovery. A bit less than a halfish mile jog, standing for a few seconds, etc. The goal was half marathon pace, 10:30-10:40's, we went 10:32, then 10:12. a bit fast the second one, but John has a 5k coming up and I could tell he wanted to go a bit. I just sat off his shoulder and rolled with it. Hotter than heck out, humid, etc. but felt comfortable enough. Just rolled with it. good stuff.

77.
So hot. Such a miserable run. Body felt fine but it's like 86 and clear skies... Haven't had a run like that yet.

With John and Jack around the lakes. Legs a little heavy from yesterday's weird, hot run. All is well.

75

On the track with Anders, Max Hanson and Johnny. Easy final tune up workout.  4x800, quick, half pace, half pace, quick. Went 2:16, 2:38, 2:37, 2:15. I'm not saying there weren't other factors involved, but I did 'out kick' Max in the last one.when was the last time you beat a national champ in his event? Albeit nearly 30 seconds off his best. 2 200s after for fun. 30, 29
Extremely hot. With Anders - got called faggots and we charged their car... but then the light changed. sucky.
In Duluth with Paul Limpf. Somewhat storming out, but felt good. Off, but good.

With the Brooks/Hanson's guys around the lakewalk. pretty strong tailwind today, but the rest of the conditions sucked. Gray, drizzly.... As long as it isn't raining at the start.

Unbelievable company up here, and it's interesting how super good runners fall into two very definite categories: Either they are super humble and friendly, or over the top pretentious prickbags. Chatted a bit with Deena Kastor, and she was plesant as all get out. Sergio Reyes, on the other hand (running with his personal caddy who jogs with him, goes to his start lines to collect his belongings, etc.) not so much.

Some dirty looking dude right outside the hotel that we're all staying in muttered 'faggot' as I was walking back in. Seriously? It's race weekend. That aside, the hospitality here is incredible. They have absolutely everything for us.

Few strides after. here we go, I guess
Back in Minneapolis with Limpf. Just easy shaggin' around the creek. Nothing was sore, just some general fatigue.

Felt just dandy out there for some solo lake circling. I'll probably just dick around the rest of this week, maybe do some strides, then back to business on Monday.

68 days, baby.
Hot out. felt pretty awful for the first 6 miles. Chinese food.... With Ders and Johnny.

With Johnny. Out early, but not early enough. Getting pretty humid out there. To Wirth, and dicked around a bit. Would be a good loop, especially if it wasn't flooded and there wasn't the dead squirrel with all those maggots. Gross.
hot. Calhoun standard.
Sloooooooow
Just a hyper easy shag around Grand Marais. These next few days will be my reset button, I think.
No idea on this one. Just spent the afternoon running around the hiking trails of Cascade State Park. Stopped to rock climb (impromtu, terrifying), ford a few rivers, and look for a moose.
Morning. Tired. Here we go, though. Back to the grind.
Just coasted along the west river standard.
With John. Really slow starting out. Morning runs...

warmed up with John for his workout, and then jogged to target field and back while he did it. Jumped in for his second to last rep - he wasn't going slow. Cooled down back home with him. 5 strides after, but my Achilles was a bit angry so I only did 5, and not hard.

West river standard. Saw two homeless guys out on the cedar lake trails, one was just yelling to himself, one asked how many miles I was doing and thought it was the coolest thing... A lady asked if I was from Africa. This time, this time for Africa.

5,4,3,2,1 out on Harriet. 88 and sunny... Got hot out there. Anders was with me until halfway through 4, but his stomach was upset from the beer of earlier, but.... It was for America. Roughly 5:10, 5:05, 4:57, 4:53, fast. The hearty just made it hard. Felt fine.
Calhoun standard. I hate seeing people on morning runs.

Felt heavy. Not sure if it was the heat, all the Chinese I've been binging on, our the fact that I stored two miles in to have a beer with keeny and drinane at the Calhoun beach. east on the creek. My bones are thirsting for some east river road action. Sunday?

Kinda actually two runs. I ran over across stonearch because metz and bekah had the grand opening of their running store and I figured I should say hi and check it out. So I had a half hour break in the middle. On my way back, on Isles, a woman said to me, as I ran by, very clearly, 'I would. 18 times.' That was a new one, but of course I'm all about it. A few other cat calls as I got closer to home. I freaking love Minneapolis in the summer.
With Theis and John. Ungodly hot even though we started early, and limited water. Tough one, but it's in the books.

morning trudge around Harriet. My feet hurt, and I just want to sleep. Haven't been sleeping well...

Oh well. Grinders gonna grind.
93 degrees so I kept it chill. Ran around the U of M, chased some baby Turkeys.... Turklets? Turkeylings? With Dave and Anders. Always an adventure.

Dreadfully hot. 10x400 @ SW, after three reps, I said to hell with it and ran by effort. There was enough visible steam rising from the track that I could brush it around with my hand. no shade, just miserable.

68, 67, 67, 68, 70, 70, 68, 69, 69, 67

took 100 seconds recovery (200 jog, a bit of standing, just because the heat was killing me. Couldn't catch my breath. In some masochistic way, I loved it.
From work in the heat of the day. Running here sucks. All hills and sidewalks.
The Creek to Cedar with Johnny. in the mid/high 60's and a breeze. glorious.
Pretty quick, I guess.
Around St. Louis Park with John. Good convo - right achillies a little sore, but nothing major. Really nice out. A lot of talent at the lakes at the end.
Slow, tired, sore. Just going through the motions.

3x10min tempo.

*The goal of this workout quickly became to finish in the same state of consciousness that I started in. It was almost 90, and a really strong wind, so I only ran 5:3x pace for the tempo portions. the effort was plenty hard. killer.
Felt all sorts of out of it. Just a flat-feeling run.

Just an easy run with Kate and Dave. Cut it five miles short cuz my Achilles still isn't right. I could have ground out five more, but why? I guess being disappointed that I only hit 100 is a pretty decent sign.

Took the morning off to let my Achilles heal up a bit, but added on so as to not fall behind for mileage this week. The added time did help it. A dull ache still, but nothing worth really even noting. I saw Finan's girlfriend Jon Peterson out walking his dog on Nokomis - got a slight head nod from him. Some middle schooler told me he was faster than me to show off to some girl he was with - I let it slide, cuz hey, maybe it'll help him out.... or something.

Bumped into Greeno and ran with him for just a little bit. Good day out there.

Bumped into Jory, Dave, and Joe Moore at the creek and Harriet, so I ran with them for a while. Some funny stories, and Joe flipped off a middle aged woman. She was kinda a dick, to be fair. Cheered for some dude doing sprints up the hill to lyndale. Jack caught us and joined for a little while.... A scorcher out there.

mid 90's later.

With Marit at Hyland park. Felt good to get away from the cities, and nice to finally have a solid reason to not run sub 7's. No idea how i'm going to do workouts this summer if we keep getting dickered by the humidity.

Up and out at 5:30 and took a nice long ride on the struggle bus. 81 and humid as bigfoot's under-dick area.

The plan: 15 mile progression run, 5 @ 7's, 5 @ 5:45ish, 5 @ 5:20ish. Nothing crazy.

The Reality: finding out the tank is empty and getting heat chills at mile 11, trying to turn the screw and grind out a little faster pace but coming up empty, and then deciding that if I can keep it under 6's it'd be a miracle. effort was there, hell, even my legs were plenty under me. But damn it if I didn't feel like I was on fire. Dizzy.

8: 09, 7:25, 7:26, 6:42, 6:42: (36:24)

5:45, 5:39, 5:46, 5:42, 5:51: (28:43)

For those of you racing torchlight tonight - Honestly, be careful.

97 degrees, and I saw two people at the lake wearing winter hats. One was even running in it...

A group of high school runners at the beach told me, 'real runner run cross country' ...if only you knew, children.

The morning shuffle.

Achilles is weird. It doesn't... 'hurt' but it's sore. like someone punched it or something.

With Marit, Alayna, and Makenna around the west suburbs. Good night to run slow (we started at a frolick, and ended reasonably) because my stomach was in knots. rough day at work, I suppose. Oh well. Putting one foot in front of the other. Ended by jumping in Alayna's aunt's pool.

Just shuffling the morning shuffle. Picked the hilliest route I could do (not intentionally) Kenwood Pkwy/Mt. Curve.

Achilles is fine - Not getting worse, not really hampering anything, but not getting better.
10x1:1. Felt awful. Heavy, tired. Stomach messed up, legs sleepy.

Finally the heat broke a bit. upper 70's today. My legs are pretty darn tired, and my body feels garbagy. I could always try, you know, taking care of it for once. But burgers are good, beer is great, and summer is fleeting.

The porch is calling again.

Around God-knows-where with Adrian and Bartley on his bike. Felt pretty good, was glad for it to be over, though. super nice out today. 60's and low 70's.

Got yelled at on the bike path a bit toward the end. You guys ever run 20 miles? fuck yourselves.
Around cedar lake with little Kate. Taking a bit of a down week this week. Not sure what that means yet, but somewhere in the 8o's probably. Whatever it takes to feel recovered.
Down kings and back. All I could think about was Alumni. I cant wait until it's over so I can focus on a different race. Like next year's Alumni.

Down to SW for a solo workout. An old guy was there doing like a million repeat 800's, and we chatted during my recovery, and I'd jog with him when I could. Dave dropped by in the middle of his run - helpful to have something to break it up in one way or another.

gorgeous out, by the way. 73, breezy, and dry.

5x2k @ Half marathon, 10k, 10k, 10k, half marathon pace. roughly 6:34 (HM: 5:15 pace), and 6:12 (10k, high 4:50's) I figured.

went:

felt rhythmic, sustainable. No where near the top end. Good signs.
Felt alright - just kinda heavy, like my blood was viscous or something.
Just an hour easy along the creek
morning trot to get moving. Kings.

On the track with Anders and Dave. Pretty interesting workout.

40x100 just about flat out. 100m jog between, continuous. The Ben Sathre workout.

cuz hip-hop saved my lyfe.

about as slow as I could go. With Kurt and Mark, Kurt was not having it out there today. I imagine this is what running is like for him meow.

My hamstrings are a bit sore from yesterday, otherwise all is well. Nothing like taking a 'down week' and instead of recovering, cramming it full of quality.

Ran in half tights and a long sleeve. Cold out there. July.

Slow starting out - a bit apprehensive about whether or not my hamstrings had recovered, but it was a night and day difference from yesterday. I'm glad I cut that run a whole 40 seconds in...

I'm as rested as I'm going to be, I think, and today begins what is, on paper, my largest 3 week training cycle ever. I'm reserving myself the right to audible on it if I feel like it's going to hurt my racing. I'm sure I'll be tired for any/all workouts I do, so I'm not sure if sacrificing a little there will be bad or not. On recovery days, I'm going to run about as slowly as I possibly can. God willing, I can stay in one piece. My biggest concern is actually going to be getting enough sleep. It's hard to stay rested at even just 100 miles.

If anyone wants company on runs, hit me up these next three weeks. Otherwise I'll be spending a lot of time with my own thoughts. I wish my resident training partner would hurry his ass up and get home... That'd help too.

Ran through neighborhoods over to SLP. I stopped at Anders and Kory's house about 6 and a half in because my jejunum was going to explode, but no one was home. Necessity being the motherfucker of decisionmaking, I left a huge pile of volatile muffin-batter in Ders's back yard. (Sorry).

Back via cedar. Everything else felt good.

wasn't thrilled about doing this workout today, even though it really isn't that hard of an effort. 2x10k with 1 mile recovery between. In past years I did it at marathon pace for the first, and then half marathon pace (which always ended up being see-how-close-to-your-pr-you-can-run) for the second. Last year my second 10k was 32:12, if I recall.

This year, I actually ended up doing 2x6miles out on the cedar lake trails, and for pace, all I wanted was something under 6:00/mile and for it to feel smooth. Stayed far away from the well on this one, as I'd like to still do mile repeats on Friday.

I had a loop planned, but it ended up being an out and back once I realized I missed my turn and was in the heart of Minnetonka.

Went:
5:47, 5:43, 5:45, 5:52, 5:50, 5:40 = 34:37
5:37, 5:39, 5:45, 5:38, 5:41, 5:48 = 34:08

Recovery day from GEAR with Lance. Good conversation, but I felt like a massive pile of dick the whole time.

On the bright side, Lance got cat-called at out of the window of a minivan by a 40-something woman and her friend. Glad to know that doesn't go away.

Along the creek. Felt heaps better than last night. Beer and pizza is truly the best recovery formula. Some guy on a bike started talking to me and I went along with him for a few miles. Interesting stuff. He was talking about how he was a runner back in the 70's/80's and did 100 mile weeks and all that jazz. Pretty baller to hear his recounting of things he would do that we still do today. He talked about strange food cravings and how he'd finish a 20 miles and just sit in his ice bath eating pizza and drinking pickle juice.

Some things never change.

Working till 10, so I dipped out around dinner and went up to Summit for an out and back. nostalgia, man. Love that place. Absolutely gorgeous out.

In keeping par with the old St. Paul training days, I was running through the shrub tunnels just west of Lexington when I came upon an individual in short shorts. It was Ian Bauer, and he still ignored me.
morning shake out with John. Bumped into Kate, and later into Victor. Discussed girls cross country, because that's the only topic that takes less than 20 minutes.

Warmup down to SW with Dave and Anders. Pretty hot on the warmup pace, cuz some guy decided to run faster than us, and we all either have fragile egos or are ballers. Either way. Got down there quick, and then had 5xMile. Dave ran straight 800's, Anders went mile, 1200, and then 8's. Dave would run the first 8 with me, and Anders would finish. The help was priceless. These felt... Not 'fun' but manageable. I may have shouted DALE BAHR!!!! at the beginning and/or conclusion of several of these, along with random patriotic buzz words- homeland security, eagles, patriotism, 'Merica, etc. Funny, helped keep the atmosphere light.

Like I said, these felt tiring, but alright as far as not going to the well (though I tried kicking from 300 out on the last one just for giggles, and immediately had to poop. so I had about a 40 meter surge before I had to just shut it down.

4:52, 4:54, 4:53, 4:54, 4:48

The temps actually got hotter as the night went on. Weird.
Easy around linden hills with John. Good to see somewhere that's not the lakes.

From the Lake street bridge along East River, through Hidden Falls, Crosby Farm, into Lowertown (highbridge) and back. stopped at run n fun just before mile 12 to use the bathroom. Cool temps, felt great out there today. It was like the opposite of the time warp - every time I checked my watch a large amount of time had passed. Felt springy and light. Good day. Bring on next week :)

Kept it really slow, cuz this jaunt puts me at 36 miles in the last 24 hours... Tired, but alright.

Like the two-beer buzzed John Leaf said, 'It's time to be a baller.'

Go time.

Coming out swingin' - pretty much the only way I know how. Luckily this run was eventful, cuz it sure wasn't fun.

First, I think God was testing me because I had a guy trying to pass me for probably a half mile before he finally just surged and did it, but once he got about 10 meters ahead, he slowed back to exactly my pace. Now this dude... He was my dream slow-roll package: He had an Ipod armband, a pony tail, a headband, a heart rate monitor, long shorts, and was heel striking in Vibrams. Literally the one day of 2013 that I wouldn't take the bait. so we circled Isles 25 feet apart.

Then, on Cedar, this lady was running toward me, attractive, but not like... crazy hot. A fit, early 30's woman with a little Latina in her or something. Anyway, I don't know what I did or how I looked, but as I went by she said, 'I'm a little too old for ya, hun.' Still not sure what to make of that.

Then I saw a woman walking a chicken, and I was told I'm cute. By a dude.

'Gold tint, shades that block out that golden haze.'

Felt better than yesterday, but the screws started to come loose around 11. 

Trying to get ahead on the week so I can actually recovery a bit at some point.

With Run n Fun. Not going to comment in here, but boy are there stories from tonight...

Got caught in a hugeass storm. Couldn't keep my eyes open.
